notes.versetext: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
notes.versecomment: Only pride or ignorance can keep one from believing that God is the creator of all the visible and invisible universe.

notes.versetext: Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
notes.versecomment: Such prayer speaks of David's utter reliance upon God. Being a mighty warrior, beloved of his people and his army he had a lot of power and liberty to do many things. But he instead just pours himself out before God in utter dependence. We must learn to walk in full reliance upon God and that is by no means to live a passive life but that for every action I take it's directed and approved by God.

notes.versetext: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
notes.versecomment:
The one who has a habit of waiting upon the Lord is never disappointed, frustrated or anxious about anything. Waiting upon the Lord is the key to our walk with God. His ways are higher than us but we may feel and complain that he is silent and slow. When we see the only immediate solution of the problem He sees the eternal solution of the problem. We must learn to wait upon the Lord. All those things which make us rush we must avoid. By not waiting upon the Lord we risk too much and it costs too much.

As a child of God we sould be able to declare this with clear concience that "from him cometh my salvation". We cannot have occassional confirmation of this blessed truth. We should have this confirmation, confidence and clarity every moment. Only He is our salvation and from no where else.

notes.versetext: In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.
notes.versecomment: David repeatedly declares that he trusts in God. While putting trust in God may sound flowery but we must know that when we put trust in Him we sign off to go by His ways. We completely throw ourselves on Him, not that we become passive in the process but for every little step we do exactly as He guides us. Without adding our own knowledge, emotions and plans into it. When we throw ourselves in utter reliance upon Him that's where we know that we will not live in any confusion any more.

notes.versetext: Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, unto thee do we give thanks: for that thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.
notes.versecomment: The one characteristic stands out for a serious follower of Christ is that he ponders on the things God has created. He ponders on works of God. We at times so much filled with our own little things that we forget and at times even avoid to pause and take a look at God's marvelous works. When we contemplate on how He has created all the indescribable creation and that how He sustains all of that from centuries before we were and after we are gone, we cannot but praise God. Once we contemplate on immensity of His power we will be able to rest assured in Him for all little issues we are surrounded with on this side of eternity.

notes.versetext: In Judah is God known: his name is great in Israel.
notes.versecomment: God is known among His people. If I claim the God of the Bible to be my God, He must be known in me and thru me. Having God within me and him not to be known is very impossible. Do people perceive God in me? People did perceive God in Joseph, in Daniel and in many others. God must be known in me. O God, I am ashamed to say that I cannot claim that He is known in me. Pardon me O God for not having that lie where you can shine  thru in me.

notes.versetext: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
notes.versecomment: Jesus being full of the Holy Spirit had no sign of laughter or any crazy things as it is taught today in the false version of Christianity. Being full of Holy Spirit did not turn out for Him in any Party of ecstasy. Often it has happened for the men of God that when they were full of Holy Spirit they were led to the wilderness.

notes.versetext: After these things the LORD appointed other seventy also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place, whither he himself would come.
notes.versecomment: Jesus appointed "other" seventy also. These are obviously not his 12 disciples. God always has His chosen working for Him and so we must be careful about being quick in judgment who God's servant is and who is not. For sure we must discern based on God's words those who are the wolves in sheep's clothing.

notes.versetext: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
notes.versecomment: We must be weeping if we are not in Zion, we have nothing to do with Babylon. Even if it rivers of Babylon, rivers are usually the place of serenity and quietness but we cannot have rested there. Our rest is only in Zion. We must not be Christians who are in Zion weeping over the things we had in Babylon like Israelites who couldn't shake off the memories of Egypt while they were on their way to the promised land.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he ceased, one of his disciples said unto him, Lord, teach us to pray, as John also taught his disciples.
notes.versecomment:
Disciples constantly witnessed the prayer life of Jesus and that made them to desire the same and not just do it but to do it in the right way. So they asked Jesus to teach them to pray. Jesus could have taught them in the past but Jesus never seemed to have asked disciples to pray. His example made them desire and also do it. Our lives must be so that who watches us may be inspired to do the godly things they see us doing. Jesus indeed has taught that our lives must be exemplary. Our lives must be teaching in itself.

The other important thing to note here is that John taught his listeners to pray. John couldn't have taught that if he himself didn't do it. Prayer life is a so important for a Christian and neglecting it has dire consequences.

notes.versetext: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him.
notes.versecomment: Jesus audience attracted publicans and sinners and that speaks a lot. The people whom we consider sinners and hooligans are sometimes are the biggest responders of the gospel.

notes.versetext: And he spake a parable unto them to this end, that men ought always to pray, and not to faint;
notes.versecomment: Jesus always gave parable to a certain end. There was a lesson in each parable. He gave this parable to the end that we may understand the importance of prayer. Persistent prayer is not pestering. It is a great privilege. If God wants us not to pray about something then He will make it clear to us but until then we must be persistent in our prayer. Any prayer which is selfless can be and should be persistent. Fainting is somehow going into the mode where we start doubting God's ability to hear our prayer or His ability to do it. But we know for sure that neither is true. God loves the prayers of His saints because that gives Him assurance of surrendered and reliant heart and He never despises such heart.

notes.versetext: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho.
notes.versecomment: Jesus is on His way to Jerusalem and He passes thro Jerusalem.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, that on one of those days, as he taught the people in the temple, and preached the gospel, the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders,
notes.versecomment: There is never in the history greater opposition to the truth but from the so-called spiritual leaders. In the time of Nehemiah also he always had to face the threats from inside. We must not lose our hearts when we face this situation as we know that the author and finisher of our faith, our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ walked thru that path already.

notes.versetext: And he looked up, and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury.
notes.versecomment: God watches all of our actions. He was watching then and He is watching even now.

notes.versetext: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:
notes.versecomment: Probably this is the third day of John witnessing about Jesus. He was already baptized by John and also endured the forty days of wilderness experience.

notes.versetext: When therefore the LORD knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,
notes.versecomment: People flocked to Jesus to get baptized and John slowly faded. The people once who were feared by the Pharisees about John are now losing the memory of John. Till the point that Herod dared to throw John into prison and there was no uproar in the public about it! John confirmed from the beginning that he was not Christ but just a precursor of Him. John's humbleness paved the way for Jesus and His disciples to baptize more people.

notes.versetext: After this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
notes.versecomment: Jesus went to attend the feast! This shows that Jesus did honor the the days of feasts which were given to Moses for the Jews. Bible does not encourage us to revile against the good customs and traditions given to us by our forefathers as far as those traditions are not turning God into itself. Mosaic law was not sufficient for salvation but surely was great aid towards it. Not that by keeping the tradition we can attain God but God wants us to not to rebel against the good traditions set by men as far as those traditions contradict God's word.

notes.versetext: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.
notes.versecomment: 1 Peter 4:12

notes.versetext: From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
notes.versecomment: King David when his heart was overwhelmed he cried out to God for help. Many times we do not cry out to God for help because of our ego and pride. We try to solve all issues ourselves or if at all when we cry out to God we want to just solve issues for us so we can live the way we want. Both approaches can lead us to greater loss and damage. We should humble ourselves and admit that only God is our help and refuge in the times of troubles not for the personal selfish agendas but out of the heart which is so committed and given up to God.

notes.versetext: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.
notes.versecomment:
When God is our rock and our salvation there is no force in the entire universe to move us or in other words, there is no greater safety and security as we have in our God. HE is unmovable rock. When we walk humbly with Him in carrying out every smallest detail what he asks to do we can claim this promise. Every promise and confirmation we can have in God comes with great responsibility.

How soon it is before we realize that all earthly promises are very futile in nature! But not so with our God. He promises and never ever turns away from it. The one who has deeply experienced the love of God would never ever look for anything else to get satisfied and will not eb satisfied with anything else unless He/She sits in His presnce and drink from His selfless and eternal love.

notes.versetext: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
notes.versecomment: There are theories which says there is a big gap of time between verse 1 & 2.

notes.versetext: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.
notes.versecomment: What happened during these six days is not recorded but I believe He spent time in prayer and in close intimacy with His Father in heaven. Jesus never took vacation for sure. He exactly knew what He is going to do everyday and after six days and sixty days and even past his resurrection. But we know that He had a great prayer life spending hours and whole night in prayer quite often. Before He was goign to go through this glorious event of transfiguration He must have prayed.

notes.versetext: Being forty days tempted of the devil. And in those days he did eat nothing: and when they were ended, he afterward hungered.
notes.versecomment:
When attacks of Devil are multiplied the only way to stand is by fasting & spending time with God. Fasting has a great impact on the life of a Christian. Jesus did not eat anything for forty days and He did not die or become faint. God who created our bodies is able to sustain us without food. 

O God forgive me as I have neglected your word, my personal prayer time and especially fasting and it has damaged my walk with you so greatly. Forgive me O Father for the sake of thy name. Amen.

notes.versetext: The LORD shall send the rod of thy strength out of Zion: rule thou in the midst of thine enemies.
notes.versecomment: Our God is mighty and when He is with His people, they rule in the midst of their enemies. Now, this is difficult to believe but we must. Being a follower of Christ, the living God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob we must know our standing with our God. There are times we do not understand how much safer we are by being under His mighty wings and we are tormented. But we should understand that He makes His people rule in the midst of the enemies.

notes.versetext: Therefore said he unto them, The harvest truly is great, but the labourers are few: pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth labourers into his harvest.
notes.versecomment: When Jesus mentioned about few laborers, He asked for prayer that God may send forth laborers. He did not ask to pray for people to donate more money but to pray to God that He would send the laborers. God is never out of resources and hence, so-called Gods servants who go around asking for money for ministry is not biblical and should not be encouraged.

notes.versetext: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
notes.versecomment: there is nothing to sing about in Babylon. In the place of sin and sinfulness, we never can worship God with all our heart.

notes.versetext: And he said unto them, When ye pray, say, Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name. Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done, as in heaven, so in earth.
notes.versecomment: There is no Holy Father on earth as some teach and practice. There is only one Holy Father and his dwelling is in Heaven. He surely lives within us thru His son Jesus Christ.

notes.versetext: While I live will I praise the LORD: I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.
notes.versecomment: It's life long commitment and determination David made that He will praise the Lord while he lives. In other words, he will praise the Lord all the days if his life. Added to that he goes further and says that he will be singing praises while he has any being and that indicates beyond the physical life. We know that our existence or our being is not just physical and even when we cease to exist physically our being are forever and hence we will be praising God all our days on this earth and beyond the grave where we will continue in our being. This is mind-boggling for our finite

notes.versetext: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
notes.versecomment: Any wise person does not look for the immediate profit in life rather he would look for the long term values. Treasure collected by means of wickedness does not profit at all. It may bring temporary respect, riches or fame but it is useless to bring inner peace in one's life. The rest which every soul longs for and that very longing is put by God Himself and only God can fulfill it.

notes.versetext: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured, saying, This man receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.
notes.versecomment: Jesus spending time with sinners, eating with them was not equal to partying or banqueting with them as some falsely believe. We must know the difference between friendship and fellowship. Friendship does not require deep agreements while fellowship does. Friends can have differences, fellowship cant afford that. Fellowship requires one heart while friendship doesn't. Going to other extreme using Jesus as an example of hanging out with sinners would cost too much. We must understand the boundaries and stay within those boundaries. But at the same time, we must not shy away from spending time with those who don't know Christ. For the sake of gospel, we should be able to sit, talk, eat with those who don't know Christ.

notes.versetext: And spake unto him, saying, Tell us, by what authority doest thou these things? or who is he that gave thee this authority?
notes.versecomment: It is not that the Pharisees didn't know with what power Jesus was doing all the mighty works and also His preaching. It was more just to catch Him somehow in His words. We must seek God's help to understand the motives behind questions, there are times when the questioner would not have pure motives but to find something in our answers with which they would attack us.

notes.versetext: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites.
notes.versecomment: This poor widow must be casting her two mites in a way that it may not draw much attention of others. As she walks along with rich people to the offering box, within her she must be feeling so small. But she walked with great faith. She gave away what all she had.

notes.versetext: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.
notes.versecomment:
We must understand and accept the fact that God does not and will not keep the branch which does not tied fruit. This should alert us greatly and make us to do that introspection if we are yielding fruits or not. Fruits always is not the # of people we can claim we brought to Christ. Fruits are the cultivation of godly virtues in us. If we don't have fruits than we are using heavenly resources for not and God doesn't allow that to happen. 

On the other hand if we are fruit bearers than God wants u to increasein fruit bearing and hence He will does the pruning. Pruning also requires cutting and that might heart. There may be beautiful looking little sprout but God knows that it is not healthy for our growth and He may take that nice looking sprout out of us so that we may produce the fruits which He desires in us. Even though the experience of pruning may not be pleasant but outcome will surely be very pleasant for us and also for His glory.

notes.versetext: And Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.
notes.versecomment: Garden of Gathesamene was not first time for Jesus and His disciples. As the verse suggests it was place Jesus and His disciples been frequently for fellowship, teaching and praying. Judas knew this very well.

notes.versetext: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
notes.versecomment: John represented as the light

notes.versetext: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.
notes.versecomment: David was a king and a warrior. He was always surrounded by the enemies, at times from within and at times from outside. There were times when the forces against him were more powerful than him. But his heart was so set upon the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob that he knew deep down in his heart that all his enemies will not stand as far as God of Israel is on his side. What a great confirmation! When our heart is set on the Lord we can enjoy this great promise! No matter who our enemy is, we are safe and secure without any doubt. We are covered in His arms and in the covert of His wings and that is our greatest security. We can joyfully and truthfully can declare that because my God is my defence all my enemies will be removed.

notes.versetext: And his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.
notes.versecomment: The glory of God is incomparable. His clothes became exceedingly white that the three witnesses could not compare in their natural context. It was supernatural. There are things only God can do. We can do our best and doing certain things with utmost care and excellence and take pride in it but when we compare with what God has done we just stand amaze and worship Him. His glory and doings are past understanding of any man on this earth.

notes.versetext: Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.
notes.versecomment: The habitation we have in the Lord is unshakeable, unmovable and everlasting. We can continually resort into that habitation. There is no fortress as our God, the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. We must remember this deepest and blessed truth forever even though at times it may not make sense, God never changes and He still is our fortress and our Rock.

notes.versetext: Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lambs among wolves.
notes.versecomment: The message is clear that we are as lambs among the wolves and hence trying to be anything but lambs will disqualify us as sent by Him. Also as lamb is incapable to fight against wolves, in fact, lamb in front of wolf always is in danger of its life and so we are as sent by God. But the secret here is that we are not at the discretion of wolves rather we are covered by God Almighty Himself and without His permission, there is no wolf who would be able to touch us or lay their hands on us.

notes.versetext: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.
notes.versecomment: God has spoken to me this thing again and again so many times that I do not have to put my hope in princes or any human being because they are finite and fallible. In the best of their strength and wisdom, they are so limited and hence looking for help in them is futile and fragile.

notes.versetext: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
notes.versecomment: A righteous may be hated when most of the people around him are filled with an average opinion about righteousness. He suffers from the lonely and deep anguish within to flee from such condition. God knows such soul and He cares for such who do not bow down to average and compromised holiness. God knows even the weakness of a righteous man and He cares enough to instruct such man to rescue him from his own follies.

notes.versetext: And he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all:
notes.versecomment:
God does not look at the amount, He looks at the heart. Sacrificial giving has the highest regards in God's eyes. We may not be able to give much but if we give with all our hearts and full trust in God that he will take care of our needs, it pleases Him greatly. That kind of giving in God's eyes is the highest giving. This widow had the last 2 mites left. She was a widow and hence she had no support in an earthly manner. We don't know what kind of Job she had but we know that she was poor. She gave it all. Jesus immediately rewarded her with greatest personal recognition. She gave more than all. 

God wants us to be such a giver. When we pile more for us it drags into the evil and we always will end up justifying ourselves about our greed for money. But we must learn to give sacrificially and God who has never failed will never fail in the future as well. He is the owner of all the wealth of this earth and outside the earth. He doesnt need to borrow from anyone and His economy never ever goes down. We must give without reservations.

notes.versetext: And when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.
notes.versecomment: Mary shows up as a caring woman a virtue which also proves that she was a godly woman. She was a guest or probably in close acquaintance of the host but she cared for the event which she could have easily avoided and disregarded. She knew for sure that Jesus can do something. She knew that Jesus was not rich and could not have bought the wine but she knew that He is not just an ordinary son but the Son of God. She approached Him immediately out of care and necessity.

notes.versetext: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.
notes.versecomment: It seems that Nicodemus though being a Pharisee, knew deep down in his heart that Jesus is sent from God and he did admit it as well. He told that to Jesus too. But to all his good talk the answer he received from Jesus was straight forward. "Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God". Jesus was not taken up by the praise he received but He instead pointed the real need Nicodemus had and that to be born again. The words of Nicodemus had no effect on Jesus, He didn't get caught up in the bliss of praise and good words. Jesus didn't even thank Nicodemus for what good things he said about Him. Out of great concern, Jesus was more focused on saving Nicodemus from his ignorance and show him the truth about the kingdom of God and how and who can enter in it.

notes.versetext: He left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.
notes.versecomment: Jesus was not running away from Pharisees out of fear but He had all His timings exact for all events which took place in His life. He had a divine appointment to fulfill in Samaria.

notes.versetext: Judas then, having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.
notes.versecomment:
Authorities of this world more often sides with evil than the godly. Judas got an army on His side against Jesus. We as a follower of Christ should not be surprised when authorities do not respond to our cause and side with ungodly. 

Why they had to come equipped with armed force to arrest Jesus? Was there any record of Jesus and His disciples of any kind of violence in the past? They all were aware of it. Then why they had to come with weapons ? Not sure but probably they may have prepared if they have to face the job of people who may be upset with arrest of Jesus!

On the other hand why Judas did what he did? What did he saw Jesus doing for three years daily walking with Him that made him so upset with Jesus that he decided to betray Jesus. Following Jesus with wrong motive surely does not go too far. Thinking of Jesus according to our standard will bring nothing but disappointment and frustration. Following God requires full surrender or else the moment will come when we may end up hating Him more than we loved Him.

notes.versetext: And said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they smote him with their hands.
notes.versecomment: When leader takes wrong steps follower are either forced to take same wrong steps to please their leader or they are boldened in their evil to take evil steps which indirectly are already approved by the action of their leader.

notes.versetext: I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
notes.versecomment: David did not desire for the luxury of the palace rather his desire was to live in the tabernacle or in other words in God's presence forever. He would trust the covert of God's wings over his own wisdom, wealth or power. We must so fully digest this undeniable truth that we cannot trust anything else but the mighty wings of God almighty spread over us. Let not devil deceive us by any means that God is invisible and distant. Our God is much more real that anything our eyes can see and our hand can touch. We can trust him for eternity.

notes.versetext: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.
notes.versecomment:
At times our enemies are not all who come with swords and spears, they may come with lying words of peace and comfort while they are filled with curse and anger towards us. This can be tricky for us to understand but our God who weighs the very thoughts of every man saves us from such deceptions and tricks as well. 

In God, we are secure not just by apparent enemies but even from deceivers as well who come near to us in the mask of a friend to harm us. How faithful God we have and how great are His promises!

notes.versetext: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.
notes.versecomment: God carefully examined all His creation.

notes.versetext: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.
notes.versecomment: It is such a humbling experience that Jesus was talking to Elias & Moses. We don't know what they did talk. But Jesus being God the son why He had any need to counsel or have discussion with Elias & Moses? This was talking to dead people, this was real. God had need to talk to Elias & Moses. All we Christians should understand that we need to humble enough to contact/talk/discuss things with our fellow brothers and sisters. If Jesus being God saw need to talk to Elias & Moses how much more should we?

notes.versetext: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
notes.versecomment: David requests God to save him from the hand of the wicked! He was a king and can easily judge the wicked man but he instead prays to God to be his deliverer. We must rely on God Almighty to save us from wicked, unrighteous and cruel men. We may act and react in our limited understanding but He would execute judgment upon wicked, unrighteous and cruel in His eternal wisdom. The only we can have sound sleep is to rest in the Lord that He will deliver us from the unrighteous.

notes.versetext: Thou art more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.
notes.versecomment: God is far more glorious and excellent than the any glorious mountains or anything in the nature.

notes.versetext: The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.
notes.versecomment: When God of Abraham, Isaac and, Jacob sworn about something there is no power in the known world or unknown world which can change it. There is none to challenge Him and so we must be at peace.

notes.versetext: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God: but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had.
notes.versecomment: Jesus confirmed that this widow gave even she was extremely poor and she gave it all. What a great life! How great was her faith! She did not murmur that money was misused in the temple. Many people don't give raising the concern that offerings are misused but we must know that God is careful enough to make them accountable who misuse offerings.

notes.versetext: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.
notes.versecomment: The answer Jesus gave to His mother seems to be harsh but probably Jesus wanted to do nothing out of family pressure or influence. He had come to His Father's will and not His own or His mother's will. This was not an act of disobedience or humiliation but drawing a line and making it known that He is come to do His Father's will only.

notes.versetext: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.
notes.versecomment: The great responsibility and an honor is upon us to bear fruits for the Lord but we can't do it ourselves. We must be drawing all energy and required resources from Him. He is our only resource and none else. If we try to bear fruits in our own power and strength we will fail. Devil always will encourage us that we can do without God but nothing is further from the truth.

notes.versetext: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them, Whom seek ye?
notes.versecomment:
This was profound question from Jesus and should have opened their eyes but the devil blinded their eyes and they couldn't see. Why do they sought Jesus? To arrest and to kill! To fulfill the plan they had planned. The plan to do away with this person that chief priest does not feel threatened and Romans don't fill threatened. But that momentary feeling of safety just pushed them to eternal damnation! They sought Jesus so their life goes well.
Why do we seek Jesus? He is asking us today. Let us sit down and lay out our reasons honestly why we love Him.

notes.versetext: Pilate therefore went forth again, and saith unto them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.
notes.versecomment: Pilate's second verbal admittance that he did not find any fault in Jesus.

notes.versetext: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
notes.versecomment: There are times that the heavenly bliss falls upon us and we do just want to stay in that state never to come out. The presence of God and the glory of God is so powerful that once a person truly grasps it and experiences it he/she would never ever want to leave that place or state. I know it has happened to me so many times that the utter blissfulness of place of worship and time of worship has just grabbed me to my core and to depart from that place or situation feels sad. Probably this would be the experience of every follower of Christ. And so did it happen with Peter too. Peter was quite expressive by his nature and so he was the first to make this suggestion to stay there for a long period of time as he was suggesting even to make a tabernacle and in other words to pitch the tent.

notes.versetext: My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
notes.versecomment:
One of the great secrets of David's life was his continued dependence and waiting on the Lord. Over the period we have arrived at the place where everything around needs to happen instantly. Not aligning with that lifestyle would put us in the bucket of a fool. But we must understand that there is no option of waiting on the Lord in our walk with the Lord. that is the only way we can grow in the Lord and enjoy His eternally blissful presence.

All our expectations must be from Him. Expectation outside of Him will be futile, disappointing and betraying. We must enjoy what we receive from Him in every area of our life.

notes.versetext: The stouthearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep: and none of the men of might have found their hands.
notes.versecomment: There are no mighty men who have stood before God....many mighty men came and are gone forever. But He lives forever and ever. He was before the earth was and He will be there when it is gone. He is unfathomable and unsearchable. Only prideful can have problem to surrender under Him. It would be utter foolishness to be able to comprehend the finiteness of us and still be so prideful to think that we can outlive Him! O God help me to understand the count of my days and the immensity of your infinite vastness.

notes.versetext: Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God:
notes.versecomment: But it is absolutely blessed who has put his hope in the Lord and that he knows deep down in his heart so firmly that God of Jacob is his help. The God who made heaven and earth and so even heaven and the earth so hence nothing in heaven and earth can do any harm while God of Jacob is the one who saves.

notes.versetext: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.
notes.versecomment: Even though Jesus' answer did not sound affirmative still Mary dared to tell servants to to do what He may say. This gives us clear indication that Jesus did not deny to help the situation but His talk to Mary was for whole different meaning. Mary knew it, she was with Him for 30 long years. Watching Him daily doing daily chores a perfectly obedient son to have. Probably this must have been her first public talk to Jesus or we do not know if it was a private talk between her and Jesus. But she was convinced that Jesus would not but help the situation.

notes.versetext: But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?
notes.versecomment: Jesus was sure where He was going and that is the fact for every follower of Christ. We know where we are going and that is to our heavenly Father. It's not a wishful guess but it's solid confirmation and an unfailing promise of God we have in Christ.

notes.versetext: And now, O Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.
notes.versecomment: Here Jesus shows His existence from eternity past before even world was created. This should help us to know deeply that Jesus was God and He is and will be God forever.

notes.versetext: Then came Jesus forth, wearing the crown of thorns, and the purple robe. And Pilate saith unto them, Behold the man!
notes.versecomment: The followers of Christ are shamed in this world. Evil people puts them on display to mock them and shame them as they did to Jesus.

notes.versetext: For he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.
notes.versecomment:
Probably this is the experience of every believer how the view and touch of His glory make us so speechless. And the fear of God's presence which so vastly different than the normal fear of danger. The fear we feel in God's presence is not life-threatening but is undescribably blissful and joyful. 

What Peter said was not wrong by any means. He was so much caught up by the experience he just had and he just wanted to stay there as long as he can in that celestially blissful moments.

notes.versetext: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.
notes.versecomment: What an unshaken confirmation that God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob is our rock, our salvation, our defence and that is the only reason we can be sure that we also will be unshaken and unmovable. All weapon formed against us by devil will not work and will never work as far as He is at our defence.

notes.versetext: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.
notes.versecomment: This is for me as I meditate upon it. Yes people on the earth has power and when that power is in the hands of unjust people who oppress us and do not recognize us when we think we should have been, it hurts. But we do not work or perform our duties to receive the praises from men. There is no honest work done under the sun which is not done for our heavenly father. When we work it is for the Lord and we must have this fixed in our heart. He is watching over our work and labor and He is our rewarder. We must not be baffled and tormented within ourselves when we are pushed aside dishonestly. Our reward is not gone, it is always there with God and He will lift us up in due times.

notes.versetext: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.
notes.versecomment: Here is the picture of a man who seems to be extremely troubled. We don't know the cause of his troubles but it seems he is bent by the burden of his soul. He has no rest in the day or no rest in the night. He is not able to speak and not able to sleep. He has searched the history for the help but nothing seems to be helping him. He is just like a Christian in the Pilgrim's Progress.

notes.versetext: There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
notes.versecomment:
John had a great witness that he was sent by God. We should covet this title over any other title the Christendom can give us. There are self-centered Christians who have grabbed many titles but they lack only one title "sent by God". They may presume it to be so but sadly their life would speak the opposite. Compare them with the life of John and that presumption would vanish faster than we can think.

We must be the one sent from God to carry out specific tasks for His glory. For every believer, God has a certain task to fulfill in his/her earthly journey. Jesus had a task to fulfill His Father's will to die on the cross. John had a task to be the forerunner of the Messiah. Abraham had a task to become the father of faith. and so on...We all have a task and we should find it out for God's glory. I wish no one would bear the false notion that God has given him a task to be a billionaire. Only those who have such secret desires and do not have the courage to openly tell that they are greedy hide behind using God to somehow legitimize such earthly desires.

notes.versetext: This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.
notes.versecomment: When a person acts in such a way that he may be perceived as spiritual and godly but still behind the scene in his/her heart he/she has nothing but personal and selfish agendas, he/she gets nothing but the rebuke from the Lord. How serious it is, to be honest, and clean our intentions before God who knows every corner of our heart and our invisible being which consists of thoughts, intentions, and emotions is also quite readable for Him! Who can hide from God! Absolutely no one!

notes.versetext: But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.
notes.versecomment: There are times when telling the truth is far more important then suppressing it. Jesus told all things to disciples which may have weighed heavy on them but it was needed to be told and Jesus did. We as a follower of Christ should never shy away from telling or practicing the truth we have received in Christ.

notes.versetext: As soon then as he had said unto them, I am he, they went backward, and fell to the ground.
notes.versecomment: Evil may get bolden over the time but the glimpse of Holiness of God and the radiance of His glory is to powerful for evil to withstand. Just by hearing from Jesus' mouth who he was devil was already fallen and defeated.

notes.versetext: When the chief priests therefore and officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify him, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Take ye him, and crucify him: for I find no fault in him.
notes.versecomment:
When the chief priest and officers saw Jesus in His already dire condition as by this time He was already flogged and filled with excruciating pain by the thorns which was constantly pricking His head, they cried out to crucify him. Let's remember that these evil men knew that they cannot put Jesus to death and so they were after Pilate to instigate Roman law on Him.

Evil has one characteristic that the one who is pissed by devil would seek more evil at the sight of evil. Brutality is the product of evil multiplying over itself.

notes.versetext: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
notes.versecomment: The voice from heaven roared and advised them to listen to Him. This was I believe by no mean a rebuke but surely was a correction. Peter just wanted to stay in this exceedingly blissful moment but not so with God. God surely wants His children to experience the blissfulness of His presence but He also wants us to go out and witness to the world sitting in the darkness and ready to perish. And only those who have experienced God's presence so deeply can go out and make deep impact in the world of darkness.

notes.versetext: In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
notes.versecomment: David's repetition of this words shows how much he is convinced and caught up in this belief and the conviction. My glory, my strength, my refuge is my God. Once we taste His presence and the eternally unchanging promises it would be so difficult for us to live in any other hope outside of Him. As years pass by we understand more and more how shacky this world is and how false & empty are its promises. And in that utter hopelessness and emptiness to know that God of Israel is our all in all is undescribably joyful.

notes.versetext: He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up the head.
notes.versecomment:
Verse 5, 6 & 7 speaks about how God rises up in His anger to deal with evil people. No matter they are mightiest kings on this earth but in His might, He just dissipates them like a vanishing smoke! His wrath is the last thing anyone would like to face.

O Lord, hide me now under thy wings as I face the evil which sometimes I think is too big to deal with. Fill my soul with thy presence and let me rest in thee that cannot be shaken. Amen.

notes.versetext: Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.
notes.versecomment: Our duty is to cry out to God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob who is our true deliverer and defender. Yes enemy may try to destroy us but God will surely show His mighty arms on our behalf to protect us and keep us.

notes.versetext: Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to the hungry. The LORD looseth the prisoners:
notes.versecomment: There is a great comfort for a child of God realizing and trusting the fact that He executes the judgment for the oppressed. He knows how to get downtrodden and persecuted out of their troubles. He might allow a certain situation as training for his children but He never will let them fall into shame.

notes.versetext: I say unto you, that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth, more than over ninety and nine just persons, which need no repentance.
notes.versecomment: Jesus no way appeals that ninety-nine were self-righteous when he says they didn't need repentance but He was simply emphasizing the fact that God takes great joy in getting the lost sheep back. A repenting sinner is a great joy to the Lord. Other ninety-nine were always with Him. But Father's heart was not happy until he found that one lost sheep.

notes.versetext: The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.
notes.versecomment:
We are also like this man with infirmity. We do know that we need to change and that we are suffering from sin a spiritual disease for very long. We go to  our own Bethesda to get healed. We try good deeds, probably to serve in the church and may other good works and we think that it will make us whole. But we find that there are others doing those things better than us and reaping the reward for it. We struggle to get rid of our spiritual disease which is much more deadly and fatal than physical disease. 

Here there is no proof that this Bethesda was from above or the angel was sent by God to stir the water. God would not do such horrible things to impotent people that from that great multitude only one person would be healed. God would not mock impotent people like this. His love and care is so much that leaving everyone except one in their state of infirmity is not possible. We have no reason to believe that this whole healing custom was from above. Such is all the remedies offered by this world. They are man made remedies and leaves many in their state of infirmity giving them false hope year after year and many unfortunately continue living in this false hope and finally die in this false hope.

But Jesus steps into the picture and this man is healed who was suffering since last 38 years. He is asking us today "Wilt thou be made whole?". Are we ready to tel Him that yes Lord I have tried everything year after year but for no avail.

notes.versetext: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
notes.versecomment: The promise here is not just that whatever ye ask it will be done but there is a condition, "if ye abide in me" that is the condition. And the one who abides in the Lord never seems of his own. The one who abides in the Lord has his will fully surrendered to Him and hence he will not can not ask anything outside His will. And in that sense whatever he/she asks God promises that He will do.

notes.versetext: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.
notes.versecomment: What a contradiction here, just few verses ago they said their law does not allow them to put Him to death and now they are saying that their law requires that He should be put to death. What changed so much in such a short period of time!

notes.versetext: So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.
notes.versecomment: David daily performed his vows. Our problem is we are occasionally meet God and most of the times only to have Him pull us out of all troubles and no more. We must be consistent in our walk with God. Reading and meditating God's words, in our prayer life and carrying out all the actions he shows us on daily basis.

notes.versetext: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.
notes.versecomment: David calls out others to trust in Him at all times because he did and he experienced the vastness of His mercy and the solid security in Him. David calls out others to pour their heart before God. Pouring our heart before anyone except God would be fatal and utterly disappointing and would make us vulnerable to dangers but pouring our heart before God is extremely relieving. He does not talk behind our backs, He takes our restless heart, sinful heart, wounded heart and replaces it with the new heart. He brings great healing and eternal hope to us.

notes.versetext: And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches off the trees, and strawed them in the way.
notes.versecomment: One thing is sure that this was not the first time Jesus was entering into the city of Jerusalem. Why never in the past the city got into such tumult and in a spirit of celebration? What made them do the things they did to make Jesus entry into the city so glorious? We don't know much about that but we know one thing that they were all filled with such a joy that they shouted "Hosanna" at the top of their lungs.

notes.versetext: The LORD openeth the eyes of the blind: the LORD raiseth them that are bowed down: the LORD loveth the righteous:
notes.versecomment: God of Jacob lifts them who are bowed down because of the oppressor. God has never failed to deliver righteous out of the hand of oppressor and from evil people.

notes.versetext: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the governor of the feast. And they bare it.
notes.versecomment:
The pots were containers of the waters for guests to wash themselves before they come in. It wasn't meant to contain something to drink out from. The command of Jesus to fill it with water was okay to obey for the servants but command to draw out of it and serve the master of the event thinking that it is wine must have been very hard on the servants. But "they bare it". 

God may ask us to something which may not seem very logical to us but if we obey it would be good for us. We must obey what God asks us to do as there is nothing but eternal blessing in obeying His voice. If the servants had not obeyed that even would have been disaster. Someone would have lost his job and host must have lot to be ashamed of. But an willing act of doing what He asked to do made that event incredibly great!

notes.versetext: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.
notes.versecomment: To the inquiry of Nicodemus, how a full-grown man can be born again, Jesus first clarified that a man needs to be born again by the water and the Spirit. That is by word and by Holy Spirit. But still, Nicodemus failed to understand the concept of being born again. Then Jesus responded to him by giving an example of wind which is so invisible and no once say this is the wind by pointing a finger, it is not a shape or form or a thing which can be seen but its presence and effects are clearly felt. In the same way, the experience of being born again is not something physical but it is purely spiritual and cannot be explained in fleshly terms. A presence of person who is born again can be clearly felt and is so effective.

notes.versetext: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.
notes.versecomment: If we are fruit bearing it would never be for our own glory but it will always will be for His glory. And also for us to qualify as His disciples we must be fruit bearing.

notes.versetext: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord:
notes.versecomment: How did they know that He was coming in the name of the Lord? Who made all this arrangement to make people say the things they said? But one thing we know that they were all sincere and quite genuine in this very unusual way of worship and honour they offered to Jesus on that day.

notes.versetext: But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus was talking about the times of persecution His disciples would face. Was Jesus trying to discourage them? Of course not, He was telling them the truth without any coverups or sugar coating. Jesus told them the truth what they will endure for the sake of His name.

Our God is a God of love, God of compassion but He is God of the truth as well. He does not give any false promises and does not give any false impression to His followers that they will have all rosy path to walk on. He indeed tells us that walking in His ways has cost attached to it. Being rejected, persecuted and even killed is the undeniable part of our Christian walk. Anyone trying to explain contrary to that is trying to make Jesus a liar.

notes.versetext: Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
notes.versecomment: This man has so many questions about God. Seems like he has waited too long and there seems to be the absence of God as he perceives. He thinks God has forgotten him, God is so angry at him! He seems to be struggling to find the answer of all he is going through.

notes.versetext: The LORD preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.
notes.versecomment: He preserveth the strangers. This is a great relief for those like me who are strange and the foreigners in the land. His promises are unfailing and unchangeable.

notes.versetext: That was the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.
notes.versecomment: Our savior Jesus Christ is the only light and no else beside Him. And it lighteth "everyman" so no one has an excuse that he/she didn't receive the light. Rejecting light is not equal to not seeing the light, rather it is rejecting after seeing it and that's where we will be judged. We will not be judged for what we didn't know but we surely will be judged for what we knew and didn't respect.

notes.versetext: As the Father hath loved me, so have I loved you: continue ye in my love.
notes.versecomment: The source of love is our Father in heaven. All other sources run dry very quickly. These days devil has succeeded to lure people to believe that the source of love is the media, all emotional stories on the screen are not true love. The true love is from the Father who gave His only begotten son to die on the cross for our sins and it's the love of the Son who offered Himself willingly to die on the cross on our behalf. And He is asking us to continue in His love. The moment that love chord is broken we will be devastated.

notes.versetext: And he said unto them, Behold, when ye are entered into the city, there shall a man meet you, bearing a pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he entereth in.
notes.versecomment: This is another incident where the name of the person whose house is being used it not mentioned. Such a grand event, the last supper and the owner of the house where it took place is never mentioned. We must be ready to do this kind of service where we do not look in the front but God who watches over everything does recognize our service for His glory. We must get rid of even the smallest intention of being seen by people.

notes.versetext: Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?
notes.versecomment: Yet one more inquiry of Nicodemus where Jesus had to challenge his knowledge of being a Pharisee. How is it possible that being so near to scripture and all that prophets spoke not understood by a master of Israel! Jesus showed Nicodemus his real blindness. It is possible that we may have memorized entire scripture and not understood it the way God wants us to understand it.

notes.versetext: The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day: it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed.
notes.versecomment: Jews were lost in the legalities and did not care about the deliverance. Being a slave of the law without understanding the law or understanding God's heart behind it can be fatal for spiritual life, such a keeping of law cannot produce a better follower of Christ, on contrary, it may end up producing an enemy fo, God.

notes.versetext: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;
notes.versecomment: Pharisees became so blind in their wickedness that they sought to kill Lazarus as well and the only reason was that because of Lazarus walking around risen from the dead many Jews had believed in Jesus. What was Jesus' fault here? Which law did He break? None! But His presence became a threat for the these Pharisees who were so much carried away by their own wicked heart. They wanted all honor and glory as a spiritual leader and they saw Jesus as a threat to their glory!

notes.versetext: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments, and abide in his love.
notes.versecomment: Jesus asked to continue in His love and now here He showed how we can continue in His love. By keeping His commandments. Not in a legalistic terms but from the heart. If we keep His commandments we will be able to remain in His love.

notes.versetext: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
notes.versecomment:
Here is the great secret of how to become a witness for God. We must speak the things that we do know and testify that we have seen. We cannot become a witness unless we have experienced the power of God ourselves. We cant become witnesses unless the real work has happened in our hearts first. We cannot show Christ unless Christ is within us. We must wait before God on our knees to receive from Him so that we can give to others or else all our labor we think we are doing for the Lord will be in vain producing nothing.

It may be possible that our witness may be rejected but rejection will never take away what we have received from the Lord.

notes.versetext: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.
notes.versecomment: God's words always brings joy. It brings boredom only to those whose heart is not set in His words. Only in Him our joy can be fulfilled. Men have tried so many other ways thru ages to bring joy and happiness, they advertise all the time how much joy and piece you can have if you get what this world has to offer and everything has failed. People are still broken, they have wealth and health and power and influence and still they don't have joy because they believed lies of devil and traded true joy with temporal one. But we can be sure that in Him our joy is fulfilled and no where else.

notes.versetext: Then said Jesus unto Peter, Put up thy sword into the sheath: the cup which my Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?
notes.versecomment: Jesus did not accept the defense in His favor. He was determined to fulfill Father's will. He was not shaken by the great sympathy shown by one of his very beloved disciple. Jesus was ready to drink the cup. There are times the rescue may seem like a blessing but we must know and should have discernment from above whether that rescue is going to keep us in God's Will or throw us out of God's Will.

notes.versetext: Jesus answered, Thou couldest have no power at all against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin.
notes.versecomment:
This is a great truth that all powers are given from above and so no one can boast that he got powers by his own. People can throw dices but God decides the outcome. 

Also when we suffer from the authorities we must not murmur or grudge but rather submit to the will of one who would judge the way authorities are exercised.

notes.versetext: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.
notes.versecomment: In my view, if I knew that Jesus was addressing me exposing me my evil heart to me I would repent and avail the forgiveness from Him. But this spiritual blind leaders had blinded themselves so much in their sinfulness that even after they realized that Jesus was referring to them and exposing their evil heart to them they even sought more evil instead of repenting.

notes.versetext: I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.
notes.versecomment: V10-12 seems to be answer he has found! He now understands that it was his infirmity that he couldn't see God's working but then he decides to remember all the years he has seen the mighty hand of the God almighty. When he remembers God's mighty hand and His marvelous works He is relieved. He seems to be at rest now that God is not sitting idle but even in midst of the apparent silence God is at work without any doubt.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy: who seeing Jesus fell on his face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
notes.versecomment: "Lord, if thou wilt" was not a tone of lack of faith but rather it was the tone of utter submission to the Lordship of Jesus. It was the example of totally surrendered will. He knew that Jesus can make him clean and he did desire to be clean.

notes.versetext: Those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil, and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.
notes.versecomment: Words heard but not meditated and pondered will be taken away by the devil for sure. Each type of land here Jesus has compared with the heart of the listener. What do we do with God's word? If are not disciplined to chew on it and hid it in our heart as David used to do then we are living at the risk of living in spiritual starvation. Careless towards Gods word has cost too much in my own life and in the lives of many. A mediocre Christian life is the product of being careless toward God's words.

notes.versetext: Then said he also to him that bade him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, neither thy kinsmen, nor thy rich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again, and a recompence be made thee.
notes.versecomment: Jesus was not trying to teach avoid friends or family members here but He was teaching about the very idea of thinking about getting the return when doing something of others. Anything done to others with a thought of being recompensed is not really done to others in reality, it is a selfish act and at the center of that seemingly help is not the one who is being helped but rather you being recompensed or the thought of being repaid. We might feel great about ourselves when we help others like this but in God's measures it is nothing but a selfish act and God will not approve this as a help.

notes.versetext: And the younger of them said to his father, Father, give me the portion of goods that falleth to me. And he divided unto them his living.
notes.versecomment: the one thing which is very surprising here is that Father actually doing what younger son asked him to do. Obviously, we can understand that the younger son is bit independent and his ask is way too much ahead of time. The property he can claim or should claim is after his father's death but here we see he is asking his portion while his father is still alive. And we do not see any arguments from father's side. The picture of God here is very interesting. God will not argue with us if we persist in our demands. He will allow the things to happen what we ask of Him. Only that we will have to go thru very through times, thru depression, thru irrecoverable loss, etc... But our God never forces His will upon us.

notes.versetext: He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.
notes.versecomment: John 14:3 - And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back and take you to be with me that you also may be where I am.

notes.versetext: If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you of heavenly things?
notes.versecomment: There is a degree in which God can reveal and show us things. If we cannot understand the simple things God is showing us from our day to day events and from nature which we can see with our eyes, God will not be able to show us the things which are in the Holy and spiritual realm. God wants us to learn from what we are experiencing in nature and in our day to day life. Once we go to that stage where we understand what is clearly visible in nature He will show us the things which is beyond the natural realm and much deeper things, heavenly things.

notes.versetext: This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.
notes.versecomment: To love one another is not a suggestion but a commandment, not something good to have but must to have.

notes.versetext: And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release him: but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou let this man go, thou art not Caesar's friend: whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar.
notes.versecomment: When these evil men could not prove anything worthy of death in Him they tactfully brought the pressure on Pilate. Jesus did not deny that He is a king and they got exactly what they needed, an accusation valid to make a case against Him that He was defying Roman reigns.

notes.versetext: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and his disciples rebuked those that brought them.
notes.versecomment: "They" brought young children to Jesus that Jesus may touch them. Do we bring our children to the Lord that He may touch them. It cannot be physical now but surely it much better and easier now to bring our children to the Lord in prayer on our knees. Not doing so we are putting our children in danger. We give devil a free pass that he may devour our children. every parent has this great blessed responsibility to bring their children to the Lord no matter how grown they are. And God in his unfailing faithfulness will surely touch them and bless them.

notes.versetext: And he put forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will: be thou clean. And immediately the leprosy departed from him.
notes.versecomment: There are so many uncleanness in our lives but the touch of Jesus can make us clean immediately. His touch is all we need and it is surely available all the time. The question is are we ready and expectant to receive that touch or deep down in our heart we are enjoying our uncleanness?

notes.versetext: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.
notes.versecomment: Let us not forget that the God we serve is full of compassion. Let not devil believe us otherwise. When Jesus saw this woman who was a widow and also that she had lost her son as well, He had compassion on her. She received mercy even without asking for it! As a follower of Christ, there are so many times in our lives where God has done His work without we even asking or praying. His care and love are beyond our comprehension.

notes.versetext: They on the rock are they, which, when they hear, receive the word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and in time of temptation fall away.
notes.versecomment: This group accepts the words but again there is no root. This is the group who thinks that they are the center of God's words and not the God so when troubled times comes they reject Gods words because they think that it didn't work for them. This group receives the word but do not understand that God is sovereign in all His doings. They fail to understand that troubled times are not God's way to harass His people but rather to cultivate them and prepare them for the greater and divine purpose.

notes.versetext: Woe unto thee, Chorazin! woe unto thee, Bethsaida! for if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon, which have been done in you, they had a great while ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus laments over the city of Chorazin, the mighty and great works were done in the city but they did not honor God or obviously did not turn from their sins. When God works in our lives there must be an affirmative response from our side in repentance and turning away from our sins. Chorazin was a Jewish city and had very much access to the teaching of the law as well as frequent teaching from Jesus. But they could not understand the value of God;'s working in them and they did not turn to God. Jesus sighed over that city and also mentioned that on the day of judgment the trouble of that city would be worse than the Tyre & Sidon. 
We must not neglect God's working in our lives. We must come back to Him in repentance and also with the heart filled with thanksgiving. With the heart turned away from sins. As God enlarges His mercy day by day, neglecting of the same enlarges His judgment equally. We will be asked in the proportion we are given.

notes.versetext: But when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the lame, the blind:
notes.versecomment: when we help those who will not be able to repay us back, that would make us real generous in the eyes of the Lord. Because there is really the giving here, a sacrificial giving. Sacrificial giving does cost. Any giving which has not cost you is not a giving at all. We should be able to help and give to those who we know will never be able to repay and that would be the real giving in the eyes of the Lord.

notes.versetext: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together, and took his journey into a far country, and there wasted his substance with riotous living.
notes.versecomment: The things done in our won wisdom does not go too far. The resources spent on worldly manner vanishes faster than we can think. We must let God take hold of all of our resources or it will be spent on the things which will never satisfy us and in the end, we will have great regret. Doing things in our own way will take us far from God. The only way we can do things in our own way is by going far away from God. Being close to God we would never lose our resources because He gives us heavenly wisdom to spend our resources in a very fruitful way. Riotous living is impossible when we are close to God. Sinful living is impossible when we are close to God. It requires to go to a far country where we have no word of God or voice of God that we can hear.

notes.versetext: And he called his ten servants, and delivered them ten pounds, and said unto them, Occupy till I come.
notes.versecomment: Mark 16:25 And He said to them, â€œGo into all the world and preach the gospel to every creature.

notes.versetext: And it shall turn to you for a testimony.
notes.versecomment: What are the things in our lives which can turn into a testimony? According to Jesus going through persecution could be a testimony.

notes.versetext: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus here is asking to go to the level where we may have to lay down our life for others. His bar of what it is to follow Him are always beyond the understanding or acceptance of a hypocrite who just wants others to know how godly he is but would not be ready even to spare few dollars for someone unless he sees some return favor. As a follower of Christ we are supposed to be ready to be vulnerable for others even to the point where we may be used despitefully, we are still supposed to give and help. 

Christian Life is not for the crafty people who under the guise of being prudent and wise take advantage of others generosity but it for those who make themselves vulnerable enough to be used despitefully by others and to the point where they may lose their very life for others. But surely their reward in heaven will be great!

notes.versetext: And when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.
notes.versecomment: Looking at the situation it is clear that the disciples weren't with Jesus. They were out in the street and as far people knew them as the followers of Christ crowd had expectation from them. As a follower of Christ people in the public square will have expectations from us and they will come to question us and make us accountable for our faith and they are not doing anything wrong in that.

notes.versetext: But when Jesus saw it, he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
notes.versecomment: May be because ignorance or annoyance disciples were not happy people bringing their children to Jesus. What a sad picture that many times our spiritual leaders are the ones who causes little ones to come to Christ. How much careful we must be as parents or elders that we may not become the reason for little children to stay away from the Lord. Jesus loves children come to Him and those are the precious souls He created in first place and so how He could but love them!

notes.versetext: And he charged him to tell no man: but go, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
notes.versecomment: Jesus wanted this healed leper to show himself to the priest so according to the Mosaic law priest can make all the checks on him to declare him clean. Work of God is always in accordance with the laws He has set. All His works are verifiable and no man can ever complain against it.

notes.versetext: And he came and touched the bier: and they that bare him stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.
notes.versecomment: Jesus touched the bier. We also need this touch. His touch makes history. Jesus spoke to a dead person. What we believe to be death is different for the God almighty. He who created everything out of nothing and the one who is the author of life has power over the death as well. And we live in this glorious hope that He has given us eternal life and even this body dies we will live forever in His presence. Deadman heard the voice of Jesus. We might feel like we are a dead man but let us know and understand and believe this fact that He has the authority over death as well!

notes.versetext: And that which fell among thorns are they, which, when they have heard, go forth, and are choked with cares and riches and pleasures of this life, and bring no fruit to perfection.
notes.versecomment: This group receives the word but it is not their priority. Their life is in pleasure and riches of this world. They are so much preoccupied with their earthly state and they end up in fruitless life fro God. An earthly mind is enmity with God. We must not trade God's words for any earthly riches or comfort ever.

notes.versetext: And thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot recompense thee: for thou shalt be recompensed at the resurrection of the just.
notes.versecomment: To be called by God as blessed comes only by giving to them who would never be able to repay. Our God Himself is like that, He has given to us things which we will never be able to repay and we must follow His example in full.

notes.versetext: And when he had spent all, there arose a mighty famine in that land; and he began to be in want.
notes.versecomment: Devil is extremely schemeful. He will wait till we are spent way too far. He will throw us into the famine when we have nothing to save us from. He knows how to kill and destroy. He keeps us in high spirit all the time while we are severely hurting ourselves thinking that we are having great fun. He knows that day is coming where we will have nothing and we will starve to death. The devil always keeps us in a false assumption that we are on top of the world until that moment comes where we realize that we are nowhere and we are about to die. Devil is so skillful in betraying people. He cannot do any better than that. He is betrayer from the beginning and so he will be till God destroys him in the lake of fire.

notes.versetext: And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things: and they derided him.
notes.versecomment: The lovers of money cannot handle the message of Jesus seriously when He said you cannot serve two masters, God and money. Money can really become our master and rightly so with the worldly people whose whole life and all its values revolve around the money. Money is their goal, their joy, their satisfaction, and their strength. Pharisees mocked Jesus for His teaching about money. May God save us and deliver us from the love of money.

notes.versetext: But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.
notes.versecomment:
It seems that the husbandmen or the keepers of the vineyard are driven by the gain. They must have agreed to terms of the owner when they accepted the job of keeping the vineyard but now they are consumed by their greed. Not only they refused to give an account of what they were doing but they beat up those who asked for the account. They showed no honesty toward the job they were given. The owner in His power would have removed these husbandmen in a moment but instead, He waited and gave them the chance to correct themselves. But they were already consumed in their greed.

Their greed reached to the height that they disregarded even the son of the owner an heir. They conspired and killed the son as well thinking that they have conquered. They thought that they have got what they planned.
