notes.versetext: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.
notes.versecomment: This is a great warning for every follower of Christ and personally to me as well. Devil will not rest pursuing a child of God, throwing all kinds of temptations on his/her way. And the devil knows from the experience which temptation will work the best. But we should know with the deepest conviction of our heart that our God is mighty and faithful to save us from any temptation. We must not go back to the sin from which He has cleansed us or the warning is so clear and loud. It is not just Jesus trying to instill fear in the hearts of this man. Jesus is saying this because it is surely a possibility and He knows it.

notes.versetext: Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.
notes.versecomment: We cannot pick and choose from what Jesus asks us to do. We must be ready to do whatever He commands us to do. We would never get the rank of being His friend by making choices but by surrendering all our choices at His feet.

notes.versetext: And straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to him saluted him.
notes.versecomment: When people saw Jesus approaching they suddenly ran to Him. People were disappointed by disciples and they came to Jesus. It is apparent there was expectation and disciples had fallen short to that.

notes.versetext: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.
notes.versecomment: Deadman stood up and spoke. We don't know what He spoke but I believe he himself also knew what has just happened! This man knew clearly that Jesus brought him to life again. His mother got him back! Jesus handed him over to his mother. The life of this woman and this young man must have been changed forever. They must have remembered this every day until they died.

notes.versetext: But that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience.
notes.versecomment: This group is the one which is pleasing in the sight of God. This group receives the word and keeps it in the heart. Remember David, he says that he has hidden His words in his heart that he may not sin. Also, remember Mary, He kept the words in her heart. We need to treasure Gods words in our heart. There is no other way where we can be fruitful and pleasant in His eyes.

notes.versetext: And he said unto them, Ye are they which justify yourselves before men; but God knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God.
notes.versecomment:
The lovers of money may well justify themselves before men. They will say so many convincing things about their practice to gather money and do all sorts of things to pile up money and treasure on this earth. Some even use God's words, twisting it in their favor to justify their love and chase for money. But God knows their hearts. Remember, God cannot be fooled. we can fool the most intelligent man but never God. 

Also, the highly esteemed among men due to their financial status sometimes just an abomination in the sight of God because He knows the hearts of men. God is not against the rich but He is surely against the ungodly and it is very likely that the riches makes one ungodly so deceitfully that one would refuse to even believe that he is ungodly. We never should attempt to be rich the way the world does. God will not approve it and we will ourselves with so many sorrows at the end.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, that when he was returned, having received the kingdom, then he commanded these servants to be called unto him, to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much every man had gained by trading.
notes.versecomment:
Romans 14:12 So then each of us shall give an account of himself to God.
2 Corinthians 5:10 For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ, that each one may receive the things done in the body, according to what he has done, whether good or bad.
Hebrews 9:27 And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:

notes.versetext: Henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.
notes.versecomment: Jesus calling us a friend is not small by any means. He makes everything known to us and it's great honor. God called Abraham a friend and He did not hide anything from him. Let us contemplate how honored we are when He calls us His friends.

notes.versetext: But they cried out, Away with him, away with him, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The chief priests answered, We have no king but Caesar.
notes.versecomment: While Pilate a pagan authority was trying his best to rescue Jesus as he indeed knew in him that Jesus was falsely being accused, the spiritual authorities were so hung up on killing Him. Even though they were being oppressed by Romans on a daily basis and that is the reason they were seeking Messiah but now they affirmed that they are okay with Roman king. This the face of evil at full display. When so called outside godliness is exposed what actually is underneath the hood. The utter blood thirsty people.

notes.versetext: And he asked the scribes, What question ye with them?
notes.versecomment: Jesus did not inquire of disciple about the conversation but he inquired of scribes or the people to know about what was going on.

notes.versetext: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and, as his custom was, he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up for to read.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus went to Synagogue as it was His custom to Go every sabbath day. Having a disciplined life is not being legalistic. We have started using these word jargon these days as it fits our convenience. When we are not disciplined in our prayer life and quiet time we easily make our escape saying that we are not legalistic. This is nothing but a devil's trap and we are willing to fall for it. 

It seems that it was not only His custom to go to synagogue but also was to read from the scripture.

notes.versetext: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.
notes.versecomment: It was Jesus custom to be alone with God. We lose so much not being alone with God. We become powerless and insensitive toward God and godly ways. We easily compromise and keep on drifting. It is dangerously harmful and at times fatal.

notes.versetext: And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.
notes.versecomment: Why should fear fall on the people by seeing this very unusual miracle? Shouldn't they be filled with joy? When God works in such a miraculous and solid way there is no place for glory or praise for men. God deserves all glory and praise! People are filled with awe and fear when God works in such an unusual way. There is confirmation and a deep solace in the hearts of people that God has visited His people.

notes.versetext: No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed; but setteth it on a candlestick, that they which enter in may see the light.
notes.versecomment: Is our candle lighted? If it is then it is impossible to cover it. No one can cover the fire, either it will burn the what covers it or cover will put it off. If we are ignited by the Holy Spirit and fire of the Holy Spirit is burning within us and people cannot see light in us then something ungodly is covering and overshadowing us. Such cover will either put us totally off and drag us away from the living God who wants us to have heavenly joy and abundant life. Or if this cover is brought by devil then it will be consumed by the fire of God burning within us.

notes.versetext: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat: and no man gave unto him.
notes.versecomment:
This young man in his own wisdom has no other means but to look for some sustenance, so he goes to the citizen fo that far country. When we are away from God we are at the mercy of the evil people. We will be begging to the ungodly and worldly people. These people will give us a job which is obviously dirty. Worldly people have their fields and their swine and they will make us feed those swine. Swine are compared to the fools in God's words. Feeding swine is making ungodly fools fat. A job which we will hate every day and will make us vomit.

This young man reached to the point where his emptiness made him think that he can eat the same food what these swine are eating and indeed tried that. We will end up accepting, believing and practicing the things ungodly fools do thinking that that will satisfy our hunger and will save us from dying. All the people around him saw this young man almost dying and feeding himself on swine food but no one cared for him. This is what the devil does, he takes us on top of the hill and casts us down into a pit where others who are also in the pit would not care a bit about us. Remember, the devil does not come for any other reason but to kill and destroy.

notes.versetext: The law and the prophets were until John: since that time the kingdom of God is preached, and every man presseth into it.
notes.versecomment: Jesus mentioned that the law and the prophets were until John. From John, it is a new covenant of preaching the kingdom of God and repentance. Jesus did not mean that Old testament is now obsolete. By no means. But He was suggesting that keeping of the law does not bring salvation rather it is the repentance of sins and trusting the lamb who taketh away the sins of this world.

notes.versetext: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to others. And when they heard it, they said, God forbid.
notes.versecomment: These foolish husbandmen blinded by their greed believed that they have won the battle only to find in the end that they will be destroyed by the owner of the vineyard. What a great warning to us? What are we doing with all that God has entrusted with us? Are we giving good account to God or are we out of control with our own ideas and lust and greed?

notes.versetext: And when he was gone forth into the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
notes.versecomment: This young man was looking for something which he knew his riches cannot give him. So he came to Jesus asking for that very thing - the eternal life. He came running and kneeling so he must have genuine desire to get what he was asking from Jesus. Also he must be sure that the only place he can go for eternal life is to go to Jesus.

notes.versetext: For nothing is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neither any thing hid, that shall not be known and come abroad.
notes.versecomment: Such a message is comforting to those who have suffered because of the name of the Lord but is a dreadful judgment on them who have exercised their secret life filled with utter sinfulness. We all must know that there is nothing we can do to hide from God.

notes.versetext: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle of the law to fail.
notes.versecomment: Some have swung to the extreme saying Jesus made law obsolete by what he mentioned in verse 16. Many have fallen into that error and they have made God out of grace. But we must understand that Jesus immediately in verse 17 made a statement that no single title of the law will ever fail. Salvation is not by the law and rituals of the law are not required as Jesus fulfilled them all.

notes.versetext: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein.
notes.versecomment: What does it mean to receive kingdom of God as a child? Children do not require big promises, with a very little offer they would trust. Children bind their all in the one they trust as if their entire life hangs on the one in whom they trust. Children are very dependent and reliant. Children are not crafty. Children are not greedy.

notes.versetext: And wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.
notes.versecomment: Here is the sad account is given by people from the public square how their expectation from His disciples has failed. What grievous it would be to God's heart when we represent His name but fail to live by it. when we cannot demonstrate enough of His life in us. How grievous it would be His heart when we fail in the public square as a representative of Christ.

notes.versetext: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that is, God.
notes.versecomment: This young man was so sure in his heart about who Jesus was. He called Jesus with highest honor which is due only to God.

notes.versetext: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised,
notes.versecomment: Jesus was very much aware that what He is going to read and tell to people is going to create some trouble but He did it anyway. He did not back off from what He was led to do by the Holy Spirit. Also what He was saying was about the great spiritual healing for the people who have seen nothing but spiritual devastation in their lives.

notes.versetext: Take heed therefore how ye hear: for whosoever hath, to him shall be given; and whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he seemeth to have.
notes.versecomment: Here is the other warning in red letters. Only hearing is not enough, we must take heed how we hear. If we do not hear carefully and properly then we will lose even that we have and it will be a big loss! But if we hear carefully God will add to what we have.

notes.versetext: Whosoever putteth away his wife, and marrieth another, committeth adultery: and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery.
notes.versecomment: Again Jesus confirmed that laws which are given for the godly living still stands. Anyone who put away his wife and marries another is committing adultery. Jesus even raised the bar further. Jesus addressed the issue of human heart here which does not like the covenantal binding. Being faithful in our earthly affairs is extremely important in our walk with God. God did not make us for no reason, He did not give us the law for no reason. He wants us to be holy as He is Holy and every word of the law is the stepping block for the same purpose. Only that in the new testament the sin is taken away once and for all by the living and Holy sacrifice of Jesus Christ. And so we are not required to have any rituals of animal sacrifice. But moral laws still stand and we should live by it.

notes.versetext: And a certain ruler asked him, saying, Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
notes.versecomment:
Many people do have this grand and very important question. How can I be saved? How Can I have eternal life? As a human God has created us with the sense of infinity and however ungodly or unbelieving we maybe but there is something within us constantly face this question where will I go from here? What will it look like after I die? 

Here is the ruler who came to Christ with this very important question. It shows that he was seeking eternal life and he indeed wanted to obtain it.

notes.versetext: He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.
notes.versecomment: These scolding words of Jesus was not for the people but rather they were for His disciples. Why would Jesus expect faith from the publicans? But He would surely expect faith from His disciples. Jesus rebuked His disciples publicly. When we fail God in the public square God would rebuke us and that is no way out of hatred but out of great expectation from being His followers.

notes.versetext: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord.
notes.versecomment:
He was talking about the blessed time they were at that particular moment that the God Himself was speaking to them and they were seeing Him with their own eyes. He was explaining His commission in a nutshell why He has come. Probably some of them or all from that congregation couldn't grasp it or didn't grasp it being influenced by the false teachers around them.

He read from Isaiah 61:1-2

notes.versetext: And the whole multitude sought to touch him: for there went virtue out of him, and healed them all.
notes.versecomment: When whole the multitude wanted to touch Him He made Himself available and let the virtue go out and heal them all. Unlikely to what all the modern charlatans who call themselves healers and do not resemble the ministry of Jesus by any means.

notes.versetext: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
notes.versecomment: It is difficult to understand why John would ask such a question? John was a cousin brother of Jesus and he himself declared at the river Jordan about Jesus "Behold the lamb of God"! He said that He is the one who is the Messiah. What could possibly be the reason why John suddenly was not sure if he was sure about who Jesus is? Probably intense pain Herod had put on him which broke him mentally and physically where out of pain he spoke these things. Is it that he may have thought that Jesus would save him from the prison and all the torture he was going through and it never happened. Isn't it surprising that Jesus did not do the miracle of bringing John to get out of the hold of Herod!

notes.versetext: And am no more worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants.
notes.versecomment: What a glorious thing happened to this young man. He came to his senses! God has spoken to us more than enough for us to come to our senses. We must reject the devil's promises of having a great fun-filled life. We must come to our senses when God's words are teaching us and speaking to us so clearly. This young man finally came to his senses and his heart was filled with repentance, true genuine repentance. He realized that in his father's house even the hired servant has more bread to satisfy them. Hired servants are not children. Hired servants have no inheritance, hired servants do not have the same status as the son. Those hired servants who may have been enjoying all the good things which they can get from their masters but still they never can have the privileges what a son can have. But this young man is now filled with great remorse and repentance. His heart has melted now realizing what a great loss he has incurred running around in his own wisdom. He realized that he has gone down lower than the hired servants and he is thinking that if my father considers me back as one of his hired servants than also it would be far better than the condition he is in right now. A condition so hopeless, a condition filled with stink, swine and selfish people all around, no one really caring for his need and his starvation.

notes.versetext: There was a certain rich man, which was clothed in purple and fine linen, and fared sumptuously every day:
notes.versecomment: This parable seems to be a real story and not just an imaginary one. Jesus says "certain rich man" and also in the next verse "certain beggar named Lazarus". These are definitive words and hence there is enough indication that these two persons were real and not the imaginary one.

notes.versetext: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good, save one, that is, God.
notes.versecomment: Jesus asked back, why he called Him "good". This also shows that this ruler exactly knew who Jesus was, that Jesus was God. This ruler indeed knew that the one who can answer this question is Jesus and no one else. He even knew the Godhood of Jesus. So, in theory, he had everything right about Jesus and that's why he came to Him with this question.

notes.versetext: Then answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.
notes.versecomment: What a great surrender of Jesus being a Son of God from eternity, the God walking upon the earth, one with Father in every possible way but utterly submissive to His Father. Did nothing of Himself but what He saw His Father do. And He did not leave anything undone what He saw His Father doing. We must be such a follower of Christ. O Lord help me to be like you, to do only things which you want me to do and not leave anything undone which  you want me to do.

notes.versetext: And Pilate wrote a title, and put it on the cross. And the writing was JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.
notes.versecomment: No one asked Pilate to put that note on the cross but just to make sure that he is seen as a friend of Caesar and also to please chief priest he put that label. The pressure of this world is powerful and getting swayed in the current is quite possible.

notes.versetext: And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.
notes.versecomment: He had great life of keeping all commandments. So by now we can see that he had sincere desire, great desperation, conviction that he needs to go to Jesus and a very sincere life to claim that he kept all the commandments from his childhood. We can be very sincere in all aspects of our life. We may be genuinely seeking the Lord, we may be making sure everyday that we do the right thing. We may have great head knowledge that Jesus is the only one whom we can go to get eternal life.

notes.versetext: And he closed the book, and he gave it again to the minister, and sat down. And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him.
notes.versecomment: Obviously what He read and what He said was uncommon for the congregation. They were all amazed and hence they had a look of anticipation. They wanted to hear more. Their look was an invitation for Jesus to speak more. Jesus had already returned to His seat but it seems that their fastened look was a clear indication that they wanted to hear more from Him or at least have Jesus make His case why He read what read and what He exactly meant by reading that scripture.

notes.versetext: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples, and said, Blessed be ye poor: for yours is the kingdom of God.
notes.versecomment: Lets, not the false teachers deceive us by any means promising us to be wealthy and healthy. The first blessedness Jesus ever spoke about was the blessedness of the poor. For such is the kingdom of God. Let the false teachers twist Gods words the way they want but we should not deflect from the pure meaning of Gods words.

notes.versetext: He said unto them, But whom say ye that I am? Peter answering said, The Christ of God.
notes.versecomment: God is interested and concerned about how we see Him and perceive Him? For others, He may be just a good man or maybe a great prophet or a great teacher but who He is for us? For us is He our savior and our Lord? Do we see Him as Christ?

notes.versetext: And another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I cannot come.
notes.versecomment:
Preoccupied people who considered their preoccupation more valuable than the supper invitation. In other words, they devalued the one who invited them to supper. There is a cost when we neglect and under prioritize the invitation from our Lord when invites us to His table. When we do not feed ourselves from His table we will just run around feeding ourselves on all kind of garbage food which devil has laid out under attractive food wrappers.

We must get out of our earthly business and honor the invitation of our heavenly Father to supper with Him.

notes.versetext: And he arose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.
notes.versecomment:
After he realized and remembered how much great trouble he has put himself in by living his father's house the next step he took was to arise and start walking back to his father. We must do the same. If we have fallen away in our foolishness, God's spirit is quickening us to realize how much grave trouble we have brought on ourselves. We must arise and start walking back to the Father. It is never late to return to Father. This young man left his job immediately when he remembered how much abundance he has in his father's home. He did not listen to anyone. Probably others may have advised him that you are already starving and it is not a good idea to leave this job now. They must have told him that hardly you could this one little job on which your survival hangs at this moment and why you would leave this job. They must have told him that you are not alone in this famine, there are so many like you so don't try to go now. But his eyes are now opened, he has found out all the lies he is being told, he has found out his own foolishness and now he is resolved to go back to his fathers home.

And we also see here fathers heart constantly longing for his lost son. He must have waited there on a daily basis. Any glimpse of his son returning was this father's daily longing. And one day he found that there is a figure like his son walking toward home. He knew that it was his son. This father's longing heart filled with joy. Son was still a great way off since father saw him. He saw his son, he was there in his skin and bones. So unrecognizable, dark skin and stinking. Father's heart got filled with compassion, he could not contain it. Father ran toward his son, didn't care about anything. He didn't care about how fool he would look. He didn't care about his clean clothes. He didn't care about his status. He ran toward his son and fell on his neck. What could have been expected to be done from son we see now being done by his father. He almost fell on his neck and kissed him. This son was stinking from top to bottom but the father didn't care about it. He kissed his son. Father's heart is filled with joy which can not be described.

Such is our savior too. He didn't care about his heavenly status and glory. He ran toward us, he died for us on the cross. He gave Himself up so fully. What a great savior we have and a great Father we have. 

Lord, I worship you as you have done this multiple times for me. I worship you O Lord for your incomprehensible love and forgiveness. You gave yourself up in full for me to redeem me and to save me. In your blood O Jesus, I pray that you cleanse me and wash me. Pardon me of all my sins and save from relying on my own wisdom. save me from all the entanglements fo the worldly joy which is so short-lived living my soul hungry and thirsty. Restore me by your side in your eternal mercy and fill me with the heavenly nourishment. In Jesus Amen.

notes.versetext: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said, The kingdom of God cometh not with observation:
notes.versecomment: Being the teachers of the law Pharisees could not get what the Kingdom of God is. Jesus quite often talked about it and Pharisees could not understand it. They thought it to be external something which they can observe and see.

notes.versetext: But he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.
notes.versecomment: These words are so profound in our lives. When God tells us that "It is I; be not afraid" we surely have no reason to be afraid of anything. Assurance God gives never fails. We can rest in this amazing, heavenly promise "be not afraid". We may have the worst circumstances and we may have the experience of the valley of the shadow of death but we can trust His words with all our heart "be not afraid". What great promises we have in Him?

notes.versetext: This title then read many of the Jews: for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city: and it was written in Hebrew, and Greek, and Latin.
notes.versecomment: Because the place was near to the city and probably close to the road many read this label. Some may have been filled with sorrow knowing that this very man had fed them, healed them and taught them. Some may have not paid any attention at all being so much preoccupied with their own business. Some may have participated in the vary act of leading Him to the cross. But there certainly was momentary triumph of the evil here. Pilate was relieved of the turmoil. Chief priests were relieved of the threat they were seeing in Jesus. Some others must have thought that if He was of no use calling Himself Messiah while He didn't do anything particularly to lead any army against Romans.

notes.versetext: And he asked his father, How long is it ago since this came unto him? And he said, Of a child.
notes.versecomment: Here is a father whose son from his childhood is demon possessed. He had come to disciples with utter desperation because he must have heard how disciples indeed had cast out demons and healed the sick. Seeing his son quite often almost at the brink of death.

notes.versetext: Then Jesus beholding him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go thy way, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, take up the cross, and follow me.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus really loved him why? because this man was sincere in his desire but having too much of self in him. Jesus knew that that self needs to taken out. Jesus knew that this man loved his riches so much and that was keeping him from truly come to the terms of God. The worldly riches had become a snare for him to live for God. So Jesus asked him to get rid of all his earthly possession.

This is what God does, He always removes the things which keeps us away from following Him with all our hearts. God loves us so much and so the things which keeps us tied away from Him, He wants us to put away. It may be relationship, wealth or even our love for knowledge and outward hard work which may not seem to be harmful to us. God knows what hinders us to live the life full of heavenly and divine joy and God wants to remove those things from our lives.

notes.versetext: And they compel one Simon a Cyrenian, who passed by, coming out of the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to bear his cross.
notes.versecomment: Probably Jesus was so weak that Roman soldiers may have thought that he would die on the way to his crucifixion. And so they compelled Simon to carry His cross. How blessed it was for Simon to carry His cross while his two sons Alexander and Rufus were watching it. An unsung hero!

notes.versetext: And he began to say unto them, This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.
notes.versecomment: And so Jesus boldly told them what He meant by reading that specific scripture. He declared indirectly that He was the Messiah. Jesus clearly declared that scripture is fulfilled today what Isaiah prophesied almost 750 years ago.

notes.versetext: Blessed are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. Blessed are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.
notes.versecomment: There are some who say that Jesus was not talking about literal physical hunger or tears here. But let us not make the mistake, He was talking about literal hunger and tears.

notes.versetext: And in that same hour he cured many of their infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many that were blind he gave sight.
notes.versecomment: As an answer to the inquiry made by John's disciples, Jesus performed more miracles and then asked them to report to John! There are times when God does not give us direct answers to our questions. He points us to His works and that may include the works He has done in our lives in the past or in someone else's life in the past. And He wants us to evaluate the situation and trust who He is.

notes.versetext: And he answered and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are these which hear the word of God, and do it.
notes.versecomment:
At first sight, it seems that Jesus answer is rude but carefully examining we can see what He meant. If Jesus was preaching and many people were listening to then what possibly could be the reason for His mother and brethren stand without? Why they were not part of the audience? They did know many years ago when He was 12 He told His mother and father that His Father's business was His priority! What were they trying to talk to Him? Even if it was to check on his well being still standing outside and waiting for Him to leave preaching and see them seems odd. 

In that sense, Jesus said that His mother and brethren were those who listen to Him and do it. Let us remember the hidden warning Jesus gave here that He does not consider the one of His own if he/she is reluctant to hear and do God's word. What a great warning! May God help us to understand and apply this in our lives.

notes.versetext: So that servant came, and shewed his lord these things. Then the master of the house being angry said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in hither the poor, and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.
notes.versecomment: the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob is the only God who loves all downtrodden and enjoys the company of the humbles. He is always open for poor, maimed, halt and blind in other words He honors and invites all those who are forgotten and despised.  Our Father loves the smallest and cares for them. Those who are insignificant in the eyes of the world are great heroes for Him. He invites them to supper and feeds them till they are satisfied.

notes.versetext: And desiring to be fed with the crumbs which fell from the rich man's table: moreover the dogs came and licked his sores.
notes.versecomment:
Condition of Lazarus explained here is graphic. He eas extremely poor and sick, filled with sores all over his body. He was so weak that he saw digs licking his sores and probably he couldn't do much about it. He didn't come over to the table of the rich man, rather he was brought to the table. This must have been going for a while by now. Surprisingly there is no mention that this rich man ever offered food to this beggar. The rich man was lost in his sumptuous lifestyle and he did not pay attention to the need of this poor man.

Quite often worldly rich people ignore the poor and needy and at times they even snatch whatever poor has. Riches and power can make one blind to this level. The sin of Sodom and Gomorrah was this, to ignore the poor and needy. God's words so repeatedly talk about taking care of poor and needy and a follower of Christ would never ignore poor and needy.

notes.versetext: Neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo there! for, behold, the kingdom of God is within you.
notes.versecomment: Jesus referred to the kingdom of as something internal, something which lives within us. The Kingdom of God is not like the earthly kingdom. The kingdom of God is something which lives in us. It must be visible in us, in our conduct, our conversations, in our day to day life. It is never to be sought out side. We must not be deceived by anybody telling us where the kingdom of God is.

notes.versetext: And he said, All these have I kept from my youth up.
notes.versecomment: Jesus intentionally reminded him all the commandments and the ruler knew then all and kept them all from his youth up or in other words, since he knew what commandments he must keep, he kept it without fail. We have here a man who every parent would desire to be their son, every wife would desire to their husband! A perfect man, in theory, keeping all commandments, and surely he was not lying otherwise Jesus would have told him on his face, no he indeed was the keeper of the law to its fullest.

notes.versetext: Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews; but that he said, I am King of the Jews.
notes.versecomment: When the heart is under the demonic influence bloodshed only propels for more bloodshed. The normal human concience becomes so foggy and blinded that pain fails to produce compassion. Rather it makes one more blood thirsty. Chief priest claiming to be the servants of God from outside but from inside filled with jealousy, hatred and envy didn't let him take his last shot of anger and revenge at Jesus. He wanted to amplify that He claimed and did say that He was the king. Somehow they were thinking they can that will take away their guilt of crucifying Him. They were trying to prove that He was crucified of His own doings and not of their false accusations.

notes.versetext: And he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had great possessions.
notes.versecomment:
This is the very very sad moment in entire Bible. A man who knew what he was lacking, he knew where to get it and when offered what he was looking for could not accept it for his love for the riches of this world. He was not ready to accept that his riches is a snare for him. He did not trust Jesus. He trusted his riches. He chose the destruction of his soul over the gift of eternal life. 

What a great sad story this is! Love for riches at the cost of permanent, eternal destruction.

notes.versetext: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?
notes.versecomment: Jesus is God and so he indeed is capable to perceive the thoughts of all. What a great comfort we have in Him! He knows our thoughts, all unspoken prayers, unspoken grief, He knows them all. At the same time, He indeed knows all kind of evils rising within our thoughts too!

notes.versetext: Blessed are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you from their company, and shall reproach you, and cast out your name as evil, for the Son of man's sake.
notes.versecomment:
Those who are ungodly will hate the followers of Christ. They would hate us to be in their company and they will reproach us and cast our names as evil, useless, retarded and what not! But we must not be worried about it or lose our heart over it as our Saviour has told us in advance that that will happen when we follow Him.

We should be rather worried when we get along quite well with worldly people.

notes.versetext: Now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship with his disciples: and he said unto them, Let us go over unto the other side of the lake. And they launched forth.
notes.versecomment: When God tells us that He wants to go with us to the other side of the lake we must rest assured of His presence to go with us. We, however, should not dare to go to the other side in our own leadings.

notes.versetext: And he went through the cities and villages, teaching, and journeying toward Jerusalem.
notes.versecomment: Jesus went through cities and villages teaching and that is how our life also should be. Wherever God takes us through we must be a proclaimer of the Gospel. He journeyed toward Jerusalem where He was going to suffer the death of the cross and He was fully aware of it. Despite the end, we must continue to preach Gospel and the good news with the people we come across.

notes.versetext: And the servant said, Lord, it is done as thou hast commanded, and yet there is room.
notes.versecomment: Yet there is room - meaning our heavenly Father always has room for all those who want to come in. He does not reject anyone who comes to Him humbly. He does not break the bruised reed. He exalts the poor and brings the lofty one down.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, that the beggar died, and was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom: the rich man also died, and was buried;
notes.versecomment:
This poor man died first and it was obvious that he would as he must have come to the point where his body fainted to the point that he may have not been able to even pick up the falling crumbs to feed himself. But his death brought a glorious change in his life. He was carried by angels to Abraham's bosom. This is beyond our understanding but Jesus said ti happened and Jesus was not playing words or making up some fancy stories. 

The most neglected man in his time, a beggar, whose only hope of survival was the crumbs falling from the table of this rich man. But obviously, a godly man as angels received him in glory so gloriously. The rich man in his utter blindness never noticed that this beggar did not come any more to his table. But death is no respecter of man. The poor man died and the rich man also died. All his riches could not stop death, his money could not stop death, his best doctors could not stop death. We must know that death is far more real than we can think. It comes and no one is out of its grip. The rich man probably lived longer because he had the best food, the best medicine, best doctors, the best facilities but the reality is that he died. 

He died and he was buried. Probably here is a great distinction between those who die in the Lord and those who in their sins. Those who die in the Lord are carried by angels in the presence of the living God. But those who die in their sins they are buried and fall into hell.

notes.versetext: And he said unto the disciples, The days will come, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and ye shall not see it.
notes.versecomment: What Jesus meant by "the days of the Son of man"? Jesus was referring to His own days on this earth where Truth was spoken unhindered and uncompromised, where the power of God was really seen in the Miracles people saw, the living gospel which they saw almost every day and touched Him, sup with Him and learned from Him. That pure ministry will be lost and there will be sigh rising up out of the one's heart to see that same pure ministry, selfless ministry, sacrificial ministry, a self-giving ministry! A ministry which did not trick anyone did not make any false promise and a ministry which laid out Himself all the way to death.

notes.versetext: Now when Jesus heard these things, he said unto him, Yet lackest thou one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribute unto the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
notes.versecomment:
The one thing which was a hurdle for this young ruler to receive eternal life was his heart so much blended in his riches. Jesus who knew what is in men's heart knew that this man has his treasures on this earth. His heart was so much tugged into this world. How to get more and keep it safe was his utmost priority. So Jesus asked him just one thing and that is to get rid of all his riches and distribute it among the poor and needy. This ruler must have done everything to be done to the poor as per the law but hsi heart must have cringed every time he gave. 

So Jesus asked him just one thing, give all that he has to the poor. And now his real heart was exposed. He could not let go of his treasures on this earth to gain heavenly treasure. How sad it is!

We have so many today who would fulfill the law so no one can find any fault in them but how sad it is that their heart is far far away from God. They keep the law to look good in the sight of men while God desires the truth in the inward parts. God wants us to have treasure in heaven. God wants us to understand that treasure in heaven is the only treasure what matters. 

We must not misuse the parable of fruit multipliers to hide our love for earthly treasure. Be sure, God will expose our hearts before us and we cant hide from Him who looks at our heart.

notes.versetext: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.
notes.versecomment:
The character of Pilate is interesting. He knew that the man He crucified is innocent, he even sought the ways to let him go free but not at the cost of his worldly honor and possessions. Here he seems to be fed up with priest outrightly trashing his suggestion to change the text.

What a tragedy, the man who even washed his hands in this matter but to no avail he ended up doing exactly what he washed his hands off.

notes.versetext: And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me.
notes.versecomment: It seems the inquiry of John was not something Jesus was happy about. He blessed those who do not doubt His deity or His Messianic work. We must not come under a load of the situation to the point where we may start doubting who He is. Now it may surely sound very difficult and God does understand all our limitations as a human being but God surely does not encourage that we may live behind the excuse of our limitations.

notes.versetext: But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled with water, and were in jeopardy.
notes.versecomment:
We must also know that lake or the ocean is filled with uncertainties, it may roar on us like mighty waves. It may baffle us and frighten us and we may even feel that God is so silent. All these may be the real possibilities. We may be filled with effects of the storm, we may be filled with water of this world which may produce fear and dread in us. We may feel that we are in jeopardy but above all, we must still remember that it is He who asked us to sail to the other side and no one else.

We must know that the presence of God does not always mean the absence of trouble and also that the presence of trouble does not always mean the absence of God.

notes.versetext: And he said to them all, If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me.
notes.versecomment: O God I have probably never understood the depth of these words. Help me to understand the depth of it. Help me to deny myself, all of me so you can be all of me and there no greater security and peace except you be my all in all.

notes.versetext: And in hell he lift up his eyes, being in torments, and seeth Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom.
notes.versecomment:
He was able to see from hell. He was being tormented. He was able to see Abraham and Lazarus both. This rich man must have boasted all his life how he is the descendant of Abraham but to no avail, he is now burning in the hell which is never going to end. His torment would be eternal with no hope of exit ever. Again let us keep in mind that Jesus was not playing with words or weaving some fancy stories to woo his audience. Jesus was God manifested in the human form and so what none could see what happened to these two men, he did see and he reported the same to his audience.

What happens after death? Let us hear from the author of life and death Himself. A godly one is carried by angels ushered into the presence of the living God along with the saints who have gone before us. But ungodly fall into eternal torment and despair where the worm never dies and fir never quench.

notes.versetext: And they shall say to you, See here; or, see there: go not after them, nor follow them.
notes.versecomment: The days will come where they will make up the stories about the kingdom of God and they will present all kind of things in the name of the kingdom of God. But Jesus clearly warned His disciples not to go after them or to follow them.

notes.versetext: But woe unto you that are rich! for ye have received your consolation.
notes.versecomment: Some say that Jesus calling poor blessed was not literal poor but that seems to be quite wrong. They say He referred poor here as poor in Spirit but then how about rich then? Was Jesus referring to rich as rich in Spirit? Why Jesus would make this contrast so clear by talking about the two very opposite ends of the spectrum and have a different meaning to it? Jesus was talking about literal poor and literal rich!

notes.versetext: And they came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we perish. Then he arose, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water: and they ceased, and there was a calm.
notes.versecomment: Disciples did the right thing that they reached out to Jesus and woke Him up. But they were so overtaken by fear that they already declared that they are perishing! We must know that reaching out to God for help and telling Him that we are perishing is a bit out of tune. Jesus indeed took charge of the situation and calmed the storm down. God upon our cry for help would never deny to help us. He indeed is ever present help in the time of trouble and we should never forget about it.

notes.versetext: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.
notes.versecomment: The thoughts and efforts of self-preservation are futile and foolish. It is not in man's hand to avoid all threats and dangers, no not even the mightest of the mighty has been successful to preserve himself. Desiring to save ourselves and that also in our own attempts would be so futile and we will wear out so soon in despair and disappointments. But when we have our life hid in Christ, death does not have any strongholds and there are no fears who can beset us or threaten us.

notes.versetext: Strive to enter in at the strait gate: for many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.
notes.versecomment: We need to strive to enter in at the strait gate and not just wait for being zapped in. The teaching which says that salvation is free and a gift of God and hence works are not required is false. We do not work to impress God, rather we work because we are obliged and He now has made us co-workers in Christ. Those who cannot and will not be able to enter is not that God wanted them to remain outside but they were disobedient and did not trust God when He called them and gave them chances after chances before God shut the door. Just like as it happened in the days of Noah, God gave them enough warnings and they chose to laugh at it and ignore it. finally they did approach to the door but it was shut and cant be opened.

notes.versetext: And he cried and said, Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue; for I am tormented in this flame.
notes.versecomment:
The rich man cried, there was the time he never cried, he always ordered and things were done. But now the scene has changed for forever, he is constantly in agony and pain and crying out for help. He never needed mercy as he was so rich probably he had a lot of people at his mercy, even Lazarus was at his mercy. But now he is in the hell crying out for mercy. Those who are too prideful to receive mercy one day will cry out for mercy at no avail. What a loss!!!

This rich man in his time on earth never took care of Lazarus, while Lazarus was trying to feed on the crumbs falling from his table. He never paid any attention to his need. And now he was begging for just touch of a wet finger, not even a drop of water! He is in a severe physical torment and wishes that someone may just give him a touch of the water. O what a severeity! what a pain!

notes.versetext: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.
notes.versecomment: This is a great commandment of Jesus to us. It is useful in our daily lives. We should never judge by outward appearance. Judgments made by outward appearance would be quick, faulty and fatal for us and also for the person who is being judged. But Jesus commands us to judge with righteous judgment. Now righteous judgment is not inherent for us. We must rely on Jesus for righteousness and hence we need to go to God before we pass the judgment. When we have God helping us to make righteous judgment, it may be slow but it will be very constructive and edifying for both parties.

notes.versetext: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
notes.versecomment:
Three times Jesus repeated the snare of riches which keep one from entering into the kingdom of God. 

O God, I surrender myself into your mighty hands. Lord uproot all the love of riches from my heart. Make it wholly thine O Lord in your mercy. Let not my heart pay attention to the wealth of this world. Let not my heart get ensnared into the riches of this world. O Lord, I want to be with you and guided by you under your loving, caring, eternally wise Lordship. Amen.

notes.versetext: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.
notes.versecomment: Same as poor and rich, Jesus was talking about literal hungry and full here. So once again we must reject the convenient interpretation of Gods words and be more sensitive and truthful about what actually it is saying irrespective of whether we like it or not.

notes.versetext: And he said unto them, Where is your faith? And they being afraid wondered, saying one to another, What manner of man is this! for he commandeth even the winds and water, and they obey him.
notes.versecomment: What brought rebuke was Jesus noticing the lack of faith. If they saw Jesus raising a man from the dead why it would be so difficult for them to believe in Him for their safety. Our God deserves our faith in Him. He has proved His power in our lives so many times in the past and still if we lack faith in Him for our present trouble, we will invite rebuke from Him for sure. We must know who is with us. We must know who has asked us to go to other side. We must know and remember all the mighty works He has done in the past and we must know that He is the King of kings and God of Gods. We must know that He is caring Father and He cares for His children.

notes.versetext: And there went great multitudes with him: and he turned, and said unto them,
notes.versecomment: Great multitude kept following Jesus and Jesus taught them and challenged them about their understanding of what t exactly means to follow Him. There were so many who followed Him but how many did know what would it cost them? Many of them knew only outward apparent benefits of following Him. They followed Him because of miracles, healing, and free food. But they were not sure what it would be to really follow Christ.

notes.versetext: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus repeated question to the audience was quite penetrating. What went ye out to see? Mostly all people knew John to be a prophet and they honored him a lot to the point where Pharisees and Sadducees were afraid to assume anything about John. So Jesus was asking people for what reason they went out to the wilderness to listen to John. If they heard John so much then why can't they understand who He was?

Many times in our lives we surround ourselves with all Christian activities and people and still we are not changed! May God save us from such errors.

notes.versetext: If any man come to me, and hate not his father, and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea, and his own life also, he cannot be my disciple.
notes.versecomment: Jesus clearly taught that following Him often means to get in troubles with others. At times it may be our own family members whom we would not really wish to get in trouble with. Jesus did clarify that there cannot be competing priorities when it comes to following Him. We cannot love our families more than we love Jesus and that no way means we have to hate any of our family members but if our family members are worldly than we cannot walk with them in their ways, we will have to make serious choice to follow Christ and that will require to choose different path than some of our closes family members. Jesus even said that we would need to count our own life also secondary when it comes to following Him. And so we can understand now how high is the bar set for following Him.

notes.versetext: And they that heard it said, Who then can be saved?
notes.versecomment: Our God is the Holy God and when He lays out His standard of righteousness before us we as a human are baffled with the same question as these people had. Who then can be saved? How a fallen human being can ever be saved? Very real intriguing question. How we can be saved? Contemplating this question we all should do.

notes.versetext: But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?
notes.versecomment: What a great testimony from the hearers of Jesus! "He speaketh boldly". Jesus never spoke the things with half meaning or half-truths. Ha taught that our speaking should be plain, yes to yes and no to no and anything above that is from the devil. We must never speak giving a different impression then what our intention. Some people have taken speaking with grace with a meaning that we can hide our emotions or sometimes even truths behind some sugary words. Now that is what Jesus has never taught neither He practiced it Himself. We must bold and still loving and gracious.

notes.versetext: And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him, Follow me.
notes.versecomment: It is so strange to understand how Jesus called Levi (Matthew). Was it arbitrary, we cannot think so. Here is the example of a glorious and divine combination of Sovereignty of God and human response. Matthew was called miraculously and he indeed followed Jesus.

notes.versetext: But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,
notes.versecomment: For a child of God, revenge is never an option. The way Jesus stands out in His teaching is that He taught His followers to love their enemies. And do good to them who hate us! As difficult as it may sound but with the grace of God there are multitudes who have gone before us have lived such life and we also must lead such a life in complete obedience to the command of our Savior!

notes.versetext: This is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
notes.versecomment: Jesus testifies about John that he was appointed messenger by God Almighty Himself to go before Him.

notes.versetext: And when he went forth to land, there met him out of the city a certain man, which had devils long time, and ware no clothes, neither abode in any house, but in the tombs.
notes.versecomment: Demonic presence in one's life leads to nudity and so many other abnormalities. OR we also can say in other words that people who practice nudity are indeed possessed by demons. Such people align themselves with the dead and all deadly things.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman of the company lifted up her voice, and said unto him, Blessed is the womb that bare thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked.
notes.versecomment: There is a starch contrast between worldly people and godly people the way they see someone blessed. For this woman, being a woman the greatest honor is to be a mother of such a great man. I believe that she was genuine in her feelings and her expression here. She could see the greatness of Jesus, of His teachings and the mighty works He was performing. She was perhaps filled with awe where she could not help but say these words.

notes.versetext: And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
notes.versecomment:
We will never be able to comprehend fully the plan of salvation God has laid out for us. It is one thing to realize, acknowledge and trust that blood of Jesus Christ is able and more than sufficient to forgive us our sins and save us from the hell. But for us to understand with our finite human knowledge how it is possible for a sinner to be forgiven by righteous and Holy God. It is impossible for us to fully comprehend the saving grace of God, at least it is incomprehensible for me.

But thats where faith picks up. We must know for sure that what is impossible with men is effortlessly possible with God. My heart just bows down with utter humbleness thinking about the vastness of His grace which covers multitudes of my sins and gives me hope that He is faithful irrespective of myself being able to understand His saving grace.

notes.versetext: Then saith he to the disciple, Behold thy mother! And from that hour that disciple took her unto his own home.
notes.versecomment: Jesus even on the cross filled with physical pain and unspeakable agony, still thought of her mother and asked his disciple to take care of her. What a great picture of being an example how children should care for their parents.

notes.versetext: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.
notes.versecomment: The great lesson here is the response of Matthew. He "left all". Many times we want to follow Lord but we can't leave all. We want some of the baggage to go with us and it just keeps us dragging back. We must let go "everything" to follow the Lord our saviour Lord Jesus Christ.

notes.versetext: Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you.
notes.versecomment: These commandments of Jesus our Savior is quite important for us to be His follower. We must pray for them who are using us despitefully. By doing so we in no way are strengthening the are of our oppressors, rather we are securing our selves by putting ourselves in the mighty arms of God of Israel. These words come to me exactly at the time I needed. As I became anxious and even became aware that maybe I am being used despitefully by my superiors, I need to pray for them as my savior Jesus Christ is clearly asking here me to do.

notes.versetext: For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.
notes.versecomment: Jesus testifies that John was the highest among all born of women. Jesus makes people understand who John is/was. But also says that in the kingdom of God it is not so. The earthly greatness is not applicable in the kingdom of God. In the kingdom of God, all it matters is that a person is sealed in the blood of Christ. And that qualification is far greater than any other qualification a person may have acquired on this earth.

notes.versetext: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of God most high? I beseech thee, torment me not.
notes.versecomment: Devil certainly is not afraid of us but he trembles at the presence of the Lord. Even though the devil might seem to be winning but let us reassure our selves that he trembles at the presence of our God, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass about an eight days after these sayings, he took Peter and John and James, and went up into a mountain to pray.
notes.versecomment: Jesus went into the mountain to pray. He needed to pray while He was on earth. How much more should we? He took the prayer companions with Himself. And how much blessed were these three guys who went with Him and witnessed the unexplainable things. They had so far only heard about Moses and Elias but now they saw them. What a divine experience it must have been to see Moses and Elias in recognizable human form but still in their heavenly bodies! If we spend time with God in prayer and go with Him up into the mountain we God will surely show us the things which we have never imagined so far. Let not the care of this world keep us from such divine experience.

notes.versetext: But he said, Yea rather, blessed are they that hear the word of God, and keep it.
notes.versecomment: But for God, there is nothing more blessed than to give attention to His words and do it or keep it. We must not forget this truth. For a Christian to meditate upon God's words is a blessing and a way of living. It must be his first breath in the morning and the last breath before he is asleep. Jesus called such a man a blessed one. Even David in his first psalm called such man a blessed one who meditates upon His words day and night.

notes.versetext: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of God, and you yourselves thrust out.
notes.versecomment: These words of Jesus clearly shows that the people who will miss entering into the kingdom of Heaven will be able to see them who entered in it. Gnashing of teeth is not just because of the torment of hell but it is also because of the highest degree of regret they never experienced before. A regret which never can be fixed for eternity.

notes.versetext: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations.
notes.versecomment:
Can Jesus say this about me? How I have been with Jesus? God must show me how I have been in the time of persecution, troubles, and suffering for His name's sake. This was a very blessed testimony Jesus gave about disciples. It shows the level of commitment and loyalty all the disciples showed in their walk with Jesus in His 3 years of ministry which is about to end. Jesus appreciated and commended them for their companionship and fellowship in times of troubles from Pharisees, Sadducees and all other spiritual leaders. Disciples must have suffered for being Jesus' alliance.

God remembers how we have been with Him in the face of persecution and troubles.

notes.versetext: And Jesus answered him, The first of all the commandments is, Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:
notes.versecomment: Jesus emphatically taught that there is only one God. Our God is absolute and is perfect in His nature containing all holiness within Him. He is not a god of something but He is the God of everything, the creator of everything and the sustainer of everything. The first commandment is to have our concept about God to be very clear that He is not plural, He is one. At times we may fail to wrap our head around this as we try to understand this from our human rationale. But He is One.

notes.versetext: (For he had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For oftentimes it had caught him: and he was kept bound with chains and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and was driven of the devil into the wilderness.)
notes.versecomment: Let us also learn that demons need a home a human body to work their way out. And demons cannot stay at rest either, whomsoever they possess they kill and destroy! But the power of the living God can surely make them flee.

notes.versetext: And as he prayed, the fashion of his countenance was altered, and his raiment was white and glistering.
notes.versecomment: As He prayed He was transfigured. When we pray God undeniably and undoubtedly changes us from Glory to Glory. After knowing this Truth how foolish it would be not to pray? God certainly purifies us when we go into His presence up into the mountain. We cannot pray without distractions when we are surrounded by all earthly clutter. But we must go up to the mountain, we must get alone with God in a place where there are no earthly distractions to steal our attention.

notes.versetext: And they shall come from the east, and from the west, and from the north, and from the south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of God.
notes.versecomment: Sitting down speaks of rest. When we get tired we sit down. The people of God will find eternal rest in the kingdom of God. While ungodly spend eternity in the torment of hell and that also seeing those who are resting in the kingdom of God.

notes.versetext: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength: this is the first commandment.
notes.versecomment: We must love our God with ALL our heart and ALL our soul and ALL our mind. Our affection, Our being/existence, Our intellectual all must be surrendered to Him without any reservation. We can give Him all or we have given Him nothing.

notes.versetext: And the angel said unto her, Fear not, Mary: for thou hast found favour with God.
notes.versecomment: God's sovereignty with Human sanctity

notes.versetext: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized of him.
notes.versecomment: Publicans heard and believed and got baptized but Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God "against themselves". They heard but not believe and were not baptized. The pride kept them away from salvation even though they were so privileged to see the Son of God with their naked eyes and touch Him for three years! What a devastation pride can bring!

notes.versetext: For as Jonas was a sign unto the Ninevites, so shall also the Son of man be to this generation.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus was appalled by the people who were seeking a sign from God. Now God in the past did give a sign to His people in many different ways but when the Word Himself was with them they were supposed to believe in Him. And Jesus clarified it by saying that there will not be any other sign than the sign of Jonah. Jonah was sent to Nineveh to proclaim God's judgment which would come over them if they do not repent. Ninevehites did not ask for any miracles or sign from heaven. They believed the word God sent to them through His prophet Jonah. And So Jesus said that these people have received the word and did not believe and hence there will not be any other sign given to them.

We must believe in God's words instead of seeking a sign.

notes.versetext: Who shall not receive manifold more in this present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.
notes.versecomment:
Many false teachers love these verses and twist them to create a false theology out of it to support their greed and earthly desires. God is faithful to His words and he indeed means what He says. Jesus did not speak about personal financial prosperity here. If that was the case all disciples must have been wealthiest men on the earth but we know that they all died as an average person financially. But we know that they had many houses, they had many children, they had many brethren for sure......

We must be careful twisting God's words in our favor when it is not.

notes.versetext: That ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
notes.versecomment: Jesus our savior has shared everything with us what He received from His Father. He appointed us a kingdom as Father appointed unto Him. He is sitting at Father's right hand and He enabled us also sit at Father's right hand at His throne. He will judge the nations and He enabled us also to judge the twelve tribes of Israel and to judge the angels. These things are not small by any means, these are the glorious things which we will never be able to understand fully until we see them with our own eyes and experience it ourselves when we enter into His kingdom.

notes.versetext: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.
notes.versecomment: In this verse and also in verse 28 Jesus seems to be at rest knowing that everything is finished exactly as it should be. What a feeling and confirmation this is just before you die you know deep down in your heart that work is finished. I must have this confirmation of having fulfilled God's will in my life before I depart from this world.

notes.versetext: Who appeared in glory, and spake of his decease which he should accomplish at Jerusalem.
notes.versecomment: This baffles me a bit and I fall short to understand what exactly was going on here. Why Father sent Moses and Elias to talk to Him what Jesus had to accomplish in Jerusalem and that He has to suffer death. But here they are having a conversation with Jesus about His coming death. God will not leave us in delusion about our future but He will surely give us clarity when we submit ourselves to Him. He will show us what waters we have to go thro. And at times He will reveal to us what troubles we will have to go thro to carry out His divine will. God showed Paul also what He will have to suffer for His name!

notes.versetext: The queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and condemn them: for she came from the utmost parts of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and, behold, a greater than Solomon is here.
notes.versecomment: Jesus again solidified His point further by giving an example of the queen of Sheeba. She had only heard about the wisdom of Solomon and she believed. Jesus said that He is greater than Solomon and people did not believe in Him.

notes.versetext: The same day there came certain of the Pharisees, saying unto him, Get thee out, and depart hence: for Herod will kill thee.
notes.versecomment: We do not know if these Pharisees were really well-wishers but they came to Jesus and asked Him to depart from the place He was in because Herod might catch Him and kill Him there.

notes.versetext: And if any man ask you, Why do ye loose him? thus shall ye say unto him, Because the Lord hath need of him.
notes.versecomment: There are times the queries of people around us may make us doubt what we are doing as asked by the Lord. We must not use our own knowledge or intellectual to explain why we are doing what we are doing rather we must exactly say what God has asked us to say. At times God's commands may sound strange and questions of people also may make us doubt if we are on the right track. We must not rely on our abilities to give answers at such time. We must rely on God almighty to complete the task He has given us.

notes.versetext: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.
notes.versecomment: While Jesus was given to talk to Samaritan woman and save her soul and thro her to bring the gospel to Samaria, disciples were all worried about food. First, they left Jesus to buy meat and after returning when they see Jesus talking to a woman they did not show any interest what had just happened. They started pursuing Jesus as well to eat the meat. Their concern probably was correct but not mature enough.

notes.versetext: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
notes.versecomment: The cruelty of Romans were beyond imagination. if the person on the cross is not dead then their legs would be broken and then they would be taken off the cross. The person would die in extreme pain with broken legs, body flogged and bleeding, thirst and starvation, may be lying somewhere on the ground out of the sight of normal society .

notes.versetext: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,
notes.versecomment: It is interesting to know that they all were on their way to Jerusalem but Jesus ended up going ahead of them! What could be the reason? Was it that Jesus already started telling them in advance what was going to happen in Jerusalem that chief priests and scribes are going to have Him killed? Was that the reason disciples were afraid as they followed Him? What a great reality of human nature affected by sinful nature! Even while we know He is the author of life we are afraid of following Him as it seems risk to our lives!

notes.versetext: But Peter and they that were with him were heavy with sleep: and when they were awake, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.
notes.versecomment: Peter, James, and John were heavy with sleep but when they awoke they could see the indescribable things! We lose so many things God wants us to see because of our spiritual slumber. Our lives become dry and have nothing exciting because of our spiritual sleep. May God help us to remain awake that we may not lose the glorious things God has in store for us to see.

notes.versetext: The men of Nineve shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and, behold, a greater than Jonas is here.
notes.versecomment:
Why men of Nineveh will rise up and condemn the generation who is seeking a sign? Because they believed in the preaching of Jonah, they did not look for the sign from heaven. But these people after having the Word Himself with them were reluctant to believe. Jesus said He is far greater than Jonah and Solomon. 

Also, both these people - queen of Sheeba and Ninevehites were gentiles and they had no problem in believing in Jesus but jews they could not believe in Him.

notes.versetext: And he said unto them, Go ye, and tell that fox, Behold, I cast out devils, and I do cures to day and to morrow, and the third day I shall be perfected.
notes.versecomment: To the advice of Pharisees responds that Herod cannot kill Him now as He knows the exact day and time when and how He will be killed. Jesus indirectly tells them that He will be killed in Jerusalem only. Jesus refers to the ruler of that region as a fox. Even though Herod is a ruler there is a supreme ruler whose times cannot be defied. Jesus said He has work to finish before His death arrives.

notes.versetext: And they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had said unto them.
notes.versecomment: If we believe in what God says now we must know that we will surely find it to be so even though there may not be any glimpse around us what He has told us. We must not forget that He is God and we are not. He laid the foundation of the earth and He knows all the days of every man living or who are about to be born. Such knowledge is beyond human comprehension but He has it. HE is the source of all past present and future. He knows all the details of our tomorrow and even till our last breath on this earth. He is God and no one else. He is the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.

notes.versetext: But I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen thy brethren.
notes.versecomment: Jesus could see beforehand how was the devil had planned to attack Peter. We must know that our loving savior knows beforehand what devil is planning to do to us and He does not only know but He intercedes for us, He Himself prays for us that devil may not overpower us. Such knowledge is so amazing and so glorious! We must rejoice with trembling and to worship such a loving savior. He did not simply forgive all our sins but He is mindful of every single moment of our lives and He deeply cares for us, far more than we can ever fathom. Yes, He pleads for us to the Father. He loves us and cares for us.

notes.versetext: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus in response to the pleading of disciples to eat said that He already has meat that they know not!
