Is it possible to stay with Jesus all the time and still not know the things God wants us to know? Based on this example it seems it is very much possible that we have not gone down to the depth of fellowship with God that one day we may hear from Him that we do not know yet.

Disciples indeed must have heard about how Jesus fanned devil off when he was tempted in the wilderness. Jesus must have told disciples how he replied devil that "man shall not live by bread alone"! But disciples forgot and now have their eyes set on the food. Even though concern may be right and bodily need may be very legitimate but when it gets primary place when the heavenly task is left unfinished, we as a follower of Christ must put our legitimate need aside and finish the task. God is not a cruel taskmaster, but He surely expects first preference and if we obey He will give us the strength even when we haven't eat.

notes.versetext: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.
notes.versecomment:
Enemies of righteousness always try to take advantage of the situation. Here when Pharisees saw that people have confusion about the identity of Jesus that they are not fully convinced yet that this is the Christ, they tried to leverage this situation by arresting Jesus. They sent soldiers/officers to take Him.

We should know that the devil is going to play the same with us as well. Devil may use people, circumstances and time to his evil advantage and hence such situations whoudl not surprise us. Our author of faith walked that path and we will too.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, as they departed from him, Peter said unto Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said.
notes.versecomment: Peter was quick in speaking and so he had bouts of speaking not knowing what he was speaking. We must be ready to hear from the Lord and less in speaking to Him. Prayer does not always mean to keep on speaking but also to keep ourselves in His presence on our knees and wait for God to speak to us and Him being a faithful God He will surely speak to us. Hurrying up in prayer keeps us away from really listening to His voice. May God enable us to hear His voice.

notes.versetext: Nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and the day following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem.
notes.versecomment: Jesus in a way lashes out at Jerusalem saying it would be difficult to believe that a prophet is killed outside of Jerusalem. What a reputation of this city, a city of temple, a city of center of worship to living God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob! A city about which God said that His throne will be there forever and ever, the throne of David!

notes.versetext: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.
notes.versecomment: These words are so glorious and so comforting for all of us God's children. There cannot be greater promise for us than this. We can bet our life on this promise without any smallest doubt or fear.

notes.versetext: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him ought to eat?
notes.versecomment: Disciples in their ignorance still do not give a thought about what Jesus was talking about. They thought that someone else has already given food to Jesus. There is no reason to believe that Jesus would leave His disciples behind and eat by Himself! He was more mindful of disciples than they could ever imagine. But they ended up applying their natural rationale to the situation instead of trying to understand His heavenly nature.

notes.versetext: Then said Jesus unto them, Yet a little while am I with you, and then I go unto him that sent me.
notes.versecomment: Jesus told people where He came from, that is from Father and He also told where is He is going, that is to Him who had sent Him. It was plain talk and people could not believe. He confirmed His heavenly authority by signs, wonders, and miracles but still, people could not believe Him. What will it take for us to trust Him? How much He has to prove Himself to us to trust Him and obey Him?

notes.versetext: The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.
notes.versecomment: Pharisees understood the claim of Jesus and so they confirmed that there is nothing Jesus do why they would stone Him but His claim of being equal to God was the reason they would stone Him.

notes.versetext: But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:
notes.versecomment: Jesus was already dead and so they had no need to do that extra work of breaking his legs. They couldn't have impose any additional torture by doing it so they didn't do it.

notes.versetext: And they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus told His disciples all the terrible things which was about to happen to Him in Jerusalem. It was loaded description what was going to happen. Disciples were well aware what cross means and hence they indeed would have realized the intense torture beyond description and public shame it will bring. They must have realized how dangerous it is to follow Him through. Jesus provided quite graphic details to them in advance.

What Jesus didn't tell them was how they are going to respond to the situation. Jesus did not tell them that they are also going to leave Him alone. Jesus had to tell Peter because he was boasting too much and Jesus knew that that boasting will not stand when the deadly cruelty comes face to face with Peter. But we know all disciples left Him alone, they ran for their lives when the moment came. Jesus knew that too but He didnt tell that to disciples. He probably didnt want to discourage them beforehand. How infinitely wise and loving savior we have in Jesus! 

Oh what could compare to this savior when being in a human flesh He needed the same encouragement which any other human would need in the time of trouble. How severely tormenting it would have been to Him where in His Godhood He knew all HE will be going through in human form! But He cared for his disciples. He did not tell them about how greatly they were going to fail Him!

O Father, please forgive me and help as day by day I spend my time here on earth in fear and trembling about my future. O God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob fill my whole being with the knowledge that You are on my side and You are mighty and faithful enough to fight all my fights and lead me through the Red sea when it requires. O God help me in my unbelief. Take my hand precious Lord, lead me on let me stand in your absolute mercy. Father it seems that the fall is just a moment away shine on me O God. Let not the darkness cover me but Lord that your glorious light may shine on me. Amen.

notes.versetext: Then said Mary unto the angel, How shall this be, seeing I know not a man?
notes.versecomment: God's divine ability against human disability

notes.versetext: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when thine eye is single, thy whole body also is full of light; but when thine eye is evil, thy body also is full of darkness.
notes.versecomment:
God clearly is speaking to me once again in a very straightforward manner.

O Father, please forgive me in your faithfulness and because of your great name. My eyes have wandered to see evil things and yes Lord whole of my being including my body is been defiled due to my eyes. Wash me O Father in the blood of Christ and seal me in the blood of Christ.

notes.versetext: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, which killest the prophets, and stonest them that are sent unto thee; how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings, and ye would not!
notes.versecomment: Jesus shows His utter desperation for this city of Jerusalem which has a history of killing the prophets. God in His abundance of mercy and love kept on sending His people to warn this city and they were met with hostility. God wanted to gather them in His healing wings but they rejected this divine love and chose their own self-righteousness.

notes.versetext: I tell you, in that night there shall be two men in one bed; the one shall be taken, and the other shall be left.
notes.versecomment:
The center idea about two people doing the same thing still one will be taken and the other will be left os that by outward activities of any person we never can know whether he/she knows God and is ready to be taken up to be with the Lord. We must be very sure about our heart and not just our outward activities. People might see us entire our lives as good as any other good Christian only to find in the end that we were just living a double life and never really had heart yielded to God in its entirety.

May God almighty give me this depth where my heart maybe with the Lord for His glory forever.


O Lord, please forgive me for the sake of thy name as entire my day I have reeled into dep deep lust of the flesh, defiling my eyes with the lust and my body with the lust while all the time I kept up the show of godliness for others to see. O Loving Father now because of your great name and because of your unchaning promises I beg you that you forgive me, cleanse me and wash me in the blood of Christ. Amen.

notes.versetext: And they understood none of these things: and this saying was hid from them, neither knew they the things which were spoken.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus informed His twelve disciples in advance all the suffering Hew will go through in Jerusalem. His words were plain and simple but disciples could not understand it. They carried a different picture of Jesus in their head. For them, He was the Son of God who cannot be defeated by anyone. The one who orders even the sea and it listens to Him. For them to understand that Jesus can fall into the hands of men was baffling thought. 

We also sometimes carry very wrong picture of God in our head. Thinking that He is almighty and creator of heaven and earth we think that we will always soar high. But we must know from Jesus example that we may go thru the sufferings, we may fall into the hands of evil people and they can even kill us. But the most glorious thought and confirmation we have is that we are eternally secured in His presence. Just because our bodies fall into the hands of evildoers cannot do any bad to our soul or our eternal life we have in Him.

O God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob I worship for your unfathomable love and forgiveness. I feel like I have just began to understand what Cross is and the vastness of your mercies. Now for thy names sake seal me in the blood of Christ and let my heart rest in peace in thy eternally blissful abode. Amen.

notes.versetext: And they said, The Lord hath need of him.
notes.versecomment: How glorious words....The Lord hath need of him! A colt who has no experience of carrying anything, have never done anything by itself. have no education or training and is just a baby in the eyes of all. But the Lord hath need of him and for a grand event where He is going to be proclaimed as a King. God has the need of people who are meek and have nothing to boast in themselves. God can use such people so gloriously. We must be like a colt to be used greatly by God.

notes.versetext: And take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and so that day come upon you unawares.
notes.versecomment: Jesus has encouraged us to be always mindful of that day when we realize that the kingdom of God is near and our redemption is near. But if we are lost in the cares of this life and submerged into the affairs of this earth, lost in the lust of the flesh and pride of life then we may end up being unaware of that day. and that day may come upon as a snare as the rest of the people on the earth.

notes.versetext: And he said, I tell thee, Peter, the cock shall not crow this day, before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me.
notes.versecomment: Peter in His hastiness spoke how He is going to be with Him all the way even to death but Jesus in His divine foreknowledge knew what Peter is going to do and He explained it to Peter so clearly. Peter did not dare to deny or argue with Jesus. Probably he was already filled with fear but he was trying to look so courageous! It wasn't much long after this Peter exactly did what Jesus told him he would do. Jesus instead of rebuking Peter prayed for him. This is such a great example of how our attitude should be toward the people we know would do mistakes.

notes.versetext: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.
notes.versecomment: Jesus explained to disciples what meat He was talking about. The earthly food may satisfy our body but our soul may still remain hungry. The real hunger is not in our stomach but it is much deeper. A person may remain unsatisfied even after having all the food he desired. But when we know, understand and do God's will that will supersede all satisfaction. The joy of doing God's will be far more satisfying and fulfilling than having food. If Jesus is our leader than we must have this mind of Jesus that we may be ready to put doing God's will ahead of our bodily hunger. We many times start doing God's work but it remains unfinished because we are more careful about our bodily needs.

notes.versetext: But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.
notes.versecomment: Not sure why piercing his side as he was already dead. But there is not a lot of tittle which was written in vain what all would happen to Him. So here they pierced His side and blood and water came out. His blood was literally shed not just he was bleeding but the literal shedding of His blood for me for many.

notes.versetext: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.
notes.versecomment: James and John were the first whom Jesus called out as His disciples and so have spent the longest time with Jesus. While Jesus is talking about how He is going to die they are concerned about the desire of their heart. The very real picture coming out of the gospel about disciples how deeply rooted sinful nature is that even after walking and talking with Jesus 24x7 for almost 3 years they were still struggling to get rid of their selfishness. This is the picture of us. No matter how much we claim to be walking with the Lord we struggle with our old sinful nature almost on a daily basis. And our savior knows that and He still loves us and cares for us.

notes.versetext: And there came a voice out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
notes.versecomment: This experience must have been very ecstatic and divine for Peter, James, and John. Getting covered by the cloud of heavenly Glory and listening to an audible voice. They would have never forgotten this in their life!

notes.versetext: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate: and verily I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until the time come when ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.
notes.versecomment: The punishment for this city was the absence of God until an appointed time. Rejecting God almighty is the costliest choice one can make. And at times that choice may become irreversible. God certainly gives time and chances to reverse it but not too long before it becomes irreversible. God gives chances even at the expense of the men and women of God whom He gives this tough task to go and talk to murderous and merciless God haters. But soon He will rise up as a judge and declare the eternal sentence on those who have defied His love and grace times and again.

notes.versetext: And they brought him to Jesus: and they cast their garments upon the colt, and they set Jesus thereon.
notes.versecomment:
It is very interesting to know that the name of the person whose donkey Jesus used is never mentioned in the scripture and Jesus did not take his name either. The triumphant entry of Jesus into Jerusalem - it was a grand event and the whole city was in tumult and excited over it. It was an event of a lifetime and the person whose donkey was used could have received the status as a celebrity if people knew Jesus asked for his donkey to be used for this glorious event. But surprisingly this persons identity is never known.

We must know that there is a multitude of Gods servants whom nobody would ever know on this side of eternity. We must not serve God so people know that we are the ones being used. We must not have slightest boasting in our hearts or desire of being known by men. We must be ready to serve the Lord even there is no name or fame.

notes.versetext: And he said unto them, When I sent you without purse, and scrip, and shoes, lacked ye any thing? And they said, Nothing.
notes.versecomment: When God sends someone for His service, He provides everything and he/she would not lack anything. Not necessarily he/she will be rich but for sure will not lack anything and never be in want or sleep hungry. A person will never have to beg when he is in the ministry ordained by god. Disciples confirmed this great truth and faithfulness of the Lord.

notes.versetext: And he spake also a parable unto them; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that was taken out of the new agreeth not with the old.
notes.versecomment: Jesus was trying to explain here that salvation is not a patchwork. The work of the cross in a Christian is not to improve but to replace. We must not expect God to fix things in our lives rather our old life must be totally done away with in the cross and we must become a new creature. It is not a covering of sins it is the removing of sins. Until we have the experience of dying there is no new life. Born again cannot happen until we are dead to this world where old is in the grave and new life in Christ is now all in all. There cannot be even micro level agreement with old sinful life, no not at all.

notes.versetext: Be ye therefore merciful, as your Father also is merciful.
notes.versecomment: The standard of being merciful is not what we set but what God has set before us. I have come across many Christians who have set the standard of being merciful and I myself also have done this many times. But let us understand and contemplate how merciful our heavenly Father is and try to reflect that same mercifulness in us.

notes.versetext: Watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man.
notes.versecomment: Lord Jesus has commanded us to pray for the days are coming which are filled with persecution and sorrows. We will not be able to stand firm during those heavy days. Those days will be filled with physical and mental torture. The only strength we have is the strength that comes from above. All other strength will fall so short and hence we must pray.

notes.versetext: Then said he unto them, But now, he that hath a purse, let him take it, and likewise his scrip: and he that hath no sword, let him sell his garment, and buy one.
notes.versecomment: Was Jesus really alluding to the fact that now disciples would need to start worrying about how they will survive? That they would need to have financial security and physical security? No never. Probably Jesus was saying that they would need to be prepared for all situations and better organized for all situations.

notes.versetext: And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.
notes.versecomment: The disciples were in a confused state and also probably emotionally down with what all had happened. They were almost unable to process to the news they got through these two men that Jesus appeared unto them on the way to Emmaus. Jesus appears to them and the first thing He speaks to them is "Peace be unto you". Our loving savior always brings peace and offers peace to us - His children. No matter where we stand in our spiritual state. At times we are on top of the mountain spiritually and other times we are wailing deep in the valley for days. But we must know that our savior is loving and caring. He will meet us and will certainly bring peace to us.

notes.versetext: What manner of saying is this that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither ye cannot come?
notes.versecomment: Jews could not understand what Jesus was saying! They were so earthly minded that they were interpreting words of Jesus as if He was going to some "place" where they cannot find Him neither they themselves cannot go. They did not ask Jesus to explain, they did not show interest to learn from Him further. He surely would have explained to them rather they chose to question Him wrongly and be prideful in their heart.

notes.versetext: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.
notes.versecomment: Jesus took very simple route to convey the great truth about how to serve the Lord? Receiving a small child with love & compassion HE said is equal to receiving Him and ultimately is equivalent to receiving Father in heaven. There are times when we do not clearly understand what it is to receive God's will or to do His will, we always think they to serve God we need to be on the stage as a preacher or a missionary in a jungle. While they are certainly one of the areas to serve the Lord but there are so many opportunities in our day to day life we can serve God. A little help to fellow human irrespective of he/she is Christian or not, good or bad, poor or rich, a little help which might seem little in our eyes but God evaluates that so differently. He considers that as if it was done to Him. We must never miss such opportunities.

notes.versetext: They said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.
notes.versecomment: James and John were trying to secure their place in glory. It is difficult to say what actually they had in their mind. If they though of Jesus as a king and themselves as His top 2 rulers, we dont know. But Jesus indeed confronted them and so there is a possibility that they had come up with selfish desires to become a ruler next to Jesus in His kingdom.

notes.versetext: Then the whole multitude of the country of the Gadarenes round about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great fear: and he went up into the ship, and returned back again.
notes.versecomment:
This is so strange! People asked Jesus to leave from their territory and Jesus did not force Himself on them either. They were fine living with a man possed with demons but they were not ready to have a Man filled with Holy Spirit! We do not know much about this region but it seems to be that they were in one accord to put Jesus out of their territory. And Jesus left! 

Oh, that we may realize how costly it is to not having the presence of God. These people were offended because of the loss of swine, their earthly possession. They rather would have a demon-possessed people among them than having Jesus! How sad! But there are times in our lives we also choose our earthly things over Jesus. Oh, that God may open our eyes and heart to realize our own situation where we have rejected Him over our own sinful life and possession.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come down from the hill, much people met him.
notes.versecomment: Jesus, Peter, James, and John came down from the hill the next day. That means they were there the entire night. And it is logical to believe that Jesus spent time in prayer far more than the disciples as they got heavy with the sleep and indeed fell asleep but when they woke up they found Jesus with Moses Elias. This indeed speaks of the prayer life of Jesus. We have the greatest example of a prayer warrior we can learn from.

notes.versetext: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple; and at night he went out, and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives.
notes.versecomment: Jesus taught how to pray and he also set an example of a prayerful life. He taught during the day and in the night He went into the mount of Olives to pray. We do not know how long did he pray but we surely can assume that He prayed for quite some time. Our private prayers can be long and should be long while our public prayers should be short. Jesus prayed nights after nights and if He needed to pray how much more do we need to pray.

notes.versetext: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
notes.versecomment: It is so apparent that disciples are so unable to believe what they were seeing and hearing. They were afraid and thought that it is some kind of spirit. In their state of mind, they are totally unable to recognize Jesus. And so we are, because of the constant failure in our spiritual life and struggling with sin we lose the capacity to recognize the voice of the Lord.

notes.versetext: In the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.
notes.versecomment: Multiple times we read here that during the feast Jesus did not stand up and teach, but He cried. This was the tone of desperation, tone of pleading, tone of persuasion.

notes.versetext: And Mary said, Behold the handmaid of the Lord; be it unto me according to thy word. And the angel departed from her.
notes.versecomment: God's faithfulness for human faith and humbleness

notes.versetext: Give, and it shall be given unto you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall men give into your bosom. For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again.
notes.versecomment: This is surely God's promise and His words are never to fail. However, we have to be watchful that we may not fall into the trap of giving only that we may receive. The message of Jesus is so different than others in this that it does not flow with most of the average goodness which you can find even in the worldly people. He wants us to give without any expectations and not keep looking for reward and be wary of it. Let Him decide of His times to reward us without we being so mindful about it.

notes.versetext: And he cried, saying, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.
notes.versecomment: Who taught this blind man that Jesus was the son of David? Probably it seems that this blind man and a beggar was a godly man. He must have talked to people about Jesus, he may have heard Jesus preaching. He must have contemplated all that he must have heard and he must have received this understanding and clarity from God about who Jesus was.

notes.versetext: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple, for to hear him.
notes.versecomment: Not only He prayed the entire night but early in the morning He was back in the temple as well as this verse says. People came to the temple early in the morning to listen to Him and it clearly shows that Jesus was there in the temple early in the morning. What a great example we have in our savior. A life of solid hard work not to get rich but to be close to the Father's heart. Having this lifestyle nothing would shake us from our stand in Christ. Spending time in God's presence is never waste. It is where we find the direction and the meaning for our life.

notes.versetext: And they said, Lord, behold, here are two swords. And he said unto them, It is enough.
notes.versecomment: If Jesus really meant that every disciple needs to have a sword then he would not say that two are enough among twelve. Disciples immediately took Jesus' words literally to be prepared for the physical fight and started counting the swords. They might have even thought that they would need to buy them more swords but Jesus stopped them. We must know that God would not allow us to use worldly weapons against our spiritual enemies. He has already warned us that our war is not against flesh and blood but against the power of darkness. Devil cannot be defeated by the sword and by bloodshed. The devil can be defeated only by the spiritual weapons and the greatest of such weapons is prayer. Prayer will keep us humble and knelt before God and tall before devil.

notes.versetext: And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?
notes.versecomment: What a great question Jesus asked? It was not for intimidation or for condemnation but it was for comfort and to open the eyes of these frightened disciples.  Our loving Savior is asking us today, He is asking me today, "Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your heart?" In other words, He is asking us why are you so anxious and worried? What a comforting God we have! He has promised He will never break the bruised reed. He will surely restore us and He will never despise the one who comes to Him with true repentance and brokenness.

notes.versetext: And they said unto him, We can. And Jesus said unto them, Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:
notes.versecomment: Jesus promised the cup of persecution to His disciple. Jesus knew how they all were going to die for the sake of the gospel.  We must follow Jesus fully aware that it may cost us everything or else we must stop to follow Him. He calls us to dare and trust Him for our very breathe. Following Jesus was never so easy until our time when suddenly following Jesus meant to be on top of the world by means of finance and every other worldly way!

notes.versetext: And he spake a parable unto them, Can the blind lead the blind? shall they not both fall into the ditch?
notes.versecomment: Jesus clearly warned the blind leaders as well as the followers who follow the blind leaders. Spiritual leaders who can not see the truth cannot show the truth to others. In their blindness, if they start leading others then both the leader and the followers are doomed to fall into the ditch. A ditch is something you cannot come out by yourselves, you need someone who is outside to pull you out. There is a great responsibility for us to know who we are following.

notes.versetext: Return to thine own house, and shew how great things God hath done unto thee. And he went his way, and published throughout the whole city how great things Jesus had done unto him.
notes.versecomment:
Jesus saw the need of this man to be in his own home town to spread the good news and become light. People of the region rejected Him but they would listen to this man from whom the demons were cast out. Jesus sent him back to his home and be an evangelist. And this man indeed became a zealous evangelist. 

God does not save men to simply go to heaven. He saves us so we become message bearer and become blessings to others. Am I a message bearer? If not then may God have mercy upon me to become a message bearer He wants me to be.

notes.versetext: And they which went before rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried so much the more, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
notes.versecomment: He was persistent in his cries to Jesus. He knew for sure that the one who can heal him and give him sight is Jesus and no one else. He knew for sure that He is the messiah and he will cure him without any doubt. So he persisted in his cries for help.

notes.versetext: And he came out, and went, as he was wont, to the mount of Olives; and his disciples also followed him.
notes.versecomment: It was customary for Jesus to go into the mountains to pray and spend time with His Father in heaven. And probably at times disciples also went with Him into the mountains. We must learn from our savior to depart into our mountain to spend time with our Father in heaven.

notes.versetext: Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.
notes.versecomment:
He assures us even in the midst of our lowest moment that He Himself is there. He wants us to stop worrying and stop getting anxious. He offers Himself to us to touch Him and have the first-hand experience and not just to hear from others about who He is. He wants us to get rid of all other thoughts and the impression we may have about Him. He wants us to know that He is the one who was nailed to the cross for us to bear our sins and He indeed carries the marks of the cross. He is resurrected savior, the glorious and the triumphant King. 

We do not know fully what kind of body we will have in the resurrection but here Jesus in His resurrected body and He has flesh and bones. These things are so mind boggling and we will have eternity to fathom it.

notes.versetext: He saith unto them, Come and see. They came and saw where he dwelt, and abode with him that day: for it was about the tenth hour.
notes.versecomment:
When these two disciples started following Jesus, the first question of Jesus to them was "What seek ye?". God is asking the same question to us as well today if we are following Him. What are you seeking? The question of Jesus is very important. We must know why are we following Him? These two disciples wanted to see where Jesus lived and Jesus did show them where He lived and these two stayed/abode with Him because it was the tenth hour. If we follow Jesus we must continue to abide with Him because we are living not just in the tenth hour but probably in the eleventh hour.

God is happy in we abiding with Him and for us, that is the safest and most joyful place to be in.

notes.versetext: Jesus said, Take ye away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith unto him, Lord, by this time he stinketh: for he hath been dead four days.
notes.versecomment: When God asks to do a certain thing, which we may find to be abnormal and unusual but we must obey to do what He asks and we would see His power. The situation may be very adverse but it should not stop us from believing His words.

notes.versetext: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared.
notes.versecomment: Jesus showed His obedience to the Father. This is such a great mystery and I do not know how we will understand but Jesus being God He did not assume the authority while He was on the earth.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, that, when Jesus was returned, the people gladly received him: for they were all waiting for him.
notes.versecomment: What a great contrast in the response Jesus got on two shores? In Gadarenes He was asked to depart and in Galilee, He was so greatly awaited and received! Which category do we fall in? Gadarenes didn't want Him because they loved their pigs and loss of pigs was a great concern for them over having Jesus with them. When we choose earthly things over Jesus we are indirectly rejecting Him. May God help us to understand this and also save us from this terrible folly.

notes.versetext: Be ye therefore ready also: for the Son of man cometh at an hour when ye think not.
notes.versecomment:
This might sound to be a threat but that is the reality. God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob obviously is not interested in part-time Christians. Every moment and all the time we must be ready and glad to see Him. 

O God I am the biggest culprit here. My heart has grown so cold and ugly over the period that I love to cling to my sin and especially the sin of lust. In your mercy Lord please forgive me and pull me out of this sin which my heart naturally loves to enjoy. Forgive me because of your great name and fill me with your Holy Spirit O Lord. Amen.

notes.versetext: And Jesus stood, and commanded him to be brought unto him: and when he was come near, he asked him,
notes.versecomment: Jesus stood. We must know for sure without any doubt in our mind and heart that there is no prayer coming out of a righteous and desperate heart, God would would ever despise, no He never wouldn't. Jesus stopped and responded to the cries of this blind beggar. He asked others to bring this blind man to him. Jesus would have given him sight without any need of him beeb brought to Him. There is a great principle we must learn to hear that God wants us to be the partakers of His glorious work on this earth. God wants us to bring the people to Him which He can do without our help.

notes.versetext: And when he was at the place, he said unto them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation.
notes.versecomment: This is a command from Jesus Himself to us if we want to save ourselves from temptations. We cannot determine to be strong against temptations in our own strength, we can pray to receive strength from above to stay strong against temptations. Yes, we have a God shown way to save ourselves from temptations and that way is prayer. We must not neglect to pray to our own folly.

notes.versetext: And when he had thus spoken, he shewed them his hands and his feet.
notes.versecomment: Jesus offered His hands and feet to disciples so that they can touch and experience His nailed pierced hands. Jesus does that even today. In our moments of despair and devastation, He is there offering us Himself that we may know that He is there and He cares for us.

notes.versetext: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?
notes.versecomment: Here is another great lesson for us that if we try to correct our brother while we assume to go by our own rules and righteousness, God doesn't approve that kind of correction as well. Clearly when we roll into sin and go out proving others how sinful they are is pure hypocrisy and is not acceptable into the site of God.

notes.versetext: Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
notes.versecomment: Jesus asked this blind man what He wanted to do unto him? And the blind man had just one simple ask "to receive my sight". Jesus knew already what this blind man needed. His cries were in general for mercy but Jesus gave him chance to open up and be specific. The ask of this blind man was genuine and honest. He needed the sight and Jesus instantly restored his sight.

notes.versetext: And when he was come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,
notes.versecomment: All around Jesus there is an atmosphere of celebration. All people are going thru an ecstatic experience of welcoming the King. In that whole scenario, Jesus looked at the city and wept. This is the sign of the godly mind. The true followers of Christ do not get caught up in the so-called party when there are lost people around. The sign of a saved person is that no matter where he or she is his/her heart is always broken over the lost. We must have the mind of Christ and this is the one example of how we should be.

notes.versetext: And he was withdrawn from them about a stone's cast, and kneeled down, and prayed,
notes.versecomment: It was customary to Jesus not only to pray but to get alone with God, away even from His disciples. We must realize and understand the need of getting alone with God. Those who get alone with God are never lonely, helpless or powerless. People who do not spend time alone with God, no matter how great they may become in the sight of men but they would be extremely poor in their walk with God and their relationship with God and it would be almost impossible for God to be glorified in and thru them. Jesus kneeled down and pray and so do we. Kneeling is a very humbling experience and those exercise it, God can work our the humbleness in them deeply.

notes.versetext: Saying, If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in this thy day, the things which belong unto thy peace! but now they are hid from thine eyes.
notes.versecomment:
God sighs about the city of Jerusalem, a city where God was worshiped. The City a dwelling place and a ruling place forever and ever for living God as God promised to king David. The city which was the pinnacle for the worship of living God. But it deteriorated to the point that it cannot see anymore as Jesus said. All the show of religiosity and rituals but no knowledge of the living God. What a sad situation!

This is possible with us as well. We can be so spiritual from outside while when God looks inside He cannot find any godliness inside!

notes.versetext: Saying, Father, if thou be willing, remove this cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.
notes.versecomment: This is the example of prayer we must follow. God would not beat us up to be honest about the desire of our heart to put before him but we must always allow God almighty to choose for us because in the best of our judgment what we can choose always would be inferior to His choice for us.

notes.versetext: And he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus beheld him, he said, Thou art Simon the son of Jona: thou shalt be called Cephas, which is by interpretation, A stone.
notes.versecomment: On the very first site of Peter Jesus called him a stone. Jesus was and is the cornerstone of the church but Peter was a stone and we all a stone in the church. Whom God chooses usually He changes the identity and there is a great purpose I believe behind it. God wants them to detach and separate themselves completely even from their old name. God changed Peter's name at the very first meeting. God called Abram and changed his name to Abraham, God changed Sarai's name to Sarah and God changed Jacob's name to Israel. And after that the only time God Himself changed someone's name was Peter. But Jesus even after changing his name continued calling him Peter as it was supposed to be meaningful over many generations in the future in church history. Peter remained Peter and he ended up denying Jesus three times. But HE was chosen one and God does not change His mind for our failures.

notes.versetext: Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable counsellor, which also waited for the kingdom of God, came, and went in boldly unto Pilate, and craved the body of Jesus.
notes.versecomment:
Joseph must have been a very devotee of Jesus but he never surfaced anywhere. But in the times when even disciples were afraid to identify themselves as companion of Jesus, Joseph went to Pilate and boldly asked to have the body of Jesus. This could have been a total disaster for his career but he did it anyways. Being bold for Jesus is very much needed. 

O Lord, I have not been bold as you want me to be. I have been bold wrongly in many cases but being bold for Jesus is which something I have missed and at times missed deliberately. Please forgive me O Lord in your mercy to be a bold witness and a follower of Christ. Amen.

notes.versetext: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.
notes.versecomment: Honest and desperate prayers are never ignored by God. Whether we can see an angel or not but we can be sure that He strengthens us when we pray. He does not break the bruised reed.

notes.versetext: And he took it, and did eat before them.
notes.versecomment: Still, disciples were not able to believe because they were overwhelmed with joy as sometimes it happens to us! So Jesus asked them for food and ate broiled fish and honey! Jesus did not leave any stone unturned to assure disciples that it was Him, their savior! Such a savior we have who would not leave us in darkness about who He is. He assures us in many different ways that He is with us and that His promises are unfailing unchanging.

notes.versetext: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.
notes.versecomment: Why would Pilate marvel at Jesus death? May be Jesus was death was quicker than usual time it would take for someone to die on the cross. May be Jesus was beaten up and tortured so much before his crucifixion that He could not pull longer on the cross and He died. Also the scripture that his body will not see any rottenness.

notes.versetext: But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day's journey; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance.
notes.versecomment: Heavenly minded people are not easily found in earthly folks. They are so marked by Holy Spirit that they never seek the company of earthly minded. They are not much bothered by earthly business, they are so abandoned to God and for the Father's business.

notes.versetext: And shall lay thee even with the ground, and thy children within thee; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation.
notes.versecomment:
The result of spiritual deterioration is fatal for any person. The enemy first will throw all the things we love and would have us believe that we are doing great. But in the end, the enemy is nothing else but to kill and destroy. Jesus prophesied that Jerusalem will be desolate. All the glory of the temple and all so-called righteousness will be exposed and gone. And the reason is that it did not realize the time God gave to return and set right.

May God help us not to be so blind and lost in our own spiritual fancies that we may lose the sight of God's truth and become so deaf that we may not be able to hear the God's voice.

notes.versetext: And when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the body to Joseph.
notes.versecomment: It is so amazing and surprising how much care Joseph took to obtain the body of Jesus!

notes.versetext: And he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold therein, and them that bought;
notes.versecomment: God does not like the business done on His name. He gave freely and He expects us to give freely. He would not suffer people making profits out of His name even in the name of facilitating the Christian resources. He will surely hold them accountable who build their empires making profits on His name, maybe an individual or a church or a so-called Christian organization.

notes.versetext: And when he rose up from prayer, and was come to his disciples, he found them sleeping for sorrow,
notes.versecomment: Disciples fell asleep of sorrow. Probably they realized how severe the time will be for Jesus and they were probably even were filled with uncertainty of their own future. They probably Jesus agonizing in prayer little away from them. The sorrow of their heart took tall on them and they fell asleep as their mind froze with the burden and sorrow. They felt so tired and their energy level went down so much that they couldn't keep on anymore.

notes.versetext: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.
notes.versecomment: This is a great example of finding. Andrew finds his brother Simon, Jesus finds Phillip, Phillip finds Nathanael. God is finding and we are His co-laborers in finding!

notes.versetext: And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
notes.versecomment: Jesus had no place oh His own to lay His own head while He was alive and He had no plan how He would be buried either. Joseph put Him in his own tomb!

notes.versetext: And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things which I say?
notes.versecomment: Just by saying that we are the follower of Christ is not enough, in fact, that does not make us follower of Christ at all. We must do all that He is asking us to do day after day. We must walk with Him and it is possible only if we are in agreement with Him in everything He says. We must be doers.

notes.versetext: And Jesus said, Somebody hath touched me: for I perceive that virtue is gone out of me.
notes.versecomment: What a great touch which was noticed by Jesus. When people were falling over Him but none touched Him but here is the woman she did not really touch Him except the border of His garment and she was the only sho really touched Him! How do we really approach God? Are we just part of a crowd or the one little meek soul who really touched Him?

notes.versetext: Saying unto them, It is written, My house is the house of prayer: but ye have made it a den of thieves.
notes.versecomment: How the house of God look like? Jesus pointed them to scripture for the answer. "It is written" (Isaiah 56:7, Jeremiah 7:11). We don't have to sit and figure out how a church should be. God has laid out the foundation of the church. Acts 2:42 is the foundation of the church. Introducing all sorts of additional things to the assembly is mostly a western idea and not found in the Bible anywhere. God did not accept and will not accept the assembly founded on the human fancies however great it may look like and especially the activities related to buying and selling to make profits will never be able to accept in the sight of God.

notes.versetext: And said unto them, Why sleep ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.
notes.versecomment: Sorrow is not an excuse to refrain from prayer. God expects us to rise up and pray or else the temptations will catch us and overpower us. There is no other formula offered in the scripture to overcome the temptations but prayer.

notes.versetext: And said unto them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:
notes.versecomment: Jesus expounded the scripture to His disciples. He personally taught scripture to them. The same scripture which they already knew but HE himself taught them and opened their understanding. We can be great scholars to make 5 point sermons and 10 principles here and 10 principles there about Christian life out of our own study in our own understanding. But until God opens our understanding we are still unlearned and cannot grasp or understand the beauty and depth of His words. Jesus showed Himself from the scripture. All miracles didn't work and even Jesus Himself standing before them as resurrected one didn't work but when He showed Himself from the scripture and gave them understanding they knew that it was He, their savior, triumphant king, everlasting Father, the almighty, prince of Peace.

notes.versetext: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.
notes.versecomment:
Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Jesus has been with Jesus for a very long time! They were there when Jesus was walking to Golgatha, they watched His crucifixion, they watched Him giving up his ghost, they watched Him buried by Joseph. These was very long spell of time and these ladies stayed up during all these! This was love which didnt let them take rest! 

How do we love Jesus? 

O God, please forgive me for giving into my own comfort while there is lot of work to do for you. Forgive me father for not enduring with you, in laboring with you when there is so much work to do! Amen.

notes.versetext: And he taught daily in the temple. But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him,
notes.versecomment: Jealousy blinds justice. All the chief priests knew clearly in their heart what they were doing and trying to do to Jesus. They knew that killing is a sin and is clearly mentioned in ten commandments something which a law keeper cannot do. But Jealousy won over the justice. They could not bear the Truth as it was ribbing them of their place in the society, their earthly profits, and power.

notes.versetext: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
notes.versecomment: Ministry does not start from anywhere else but right where we live. It starts from our home and our street and our town and our country! Ministry and especially preaching is always about repentance and remission of sins, not how big you can get financially or in your earthly life.

notes.versetext: He is like a man which built an house, and digged deep, and laid the foundation on a rock: and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently upon that house, and could not shake it: for it was founded upon a rock.
notes.versecomment: Are we founded upon the rock? When our foundation is Christ Himself and His words, there are no storms out there which can destroy us. We will not be moved. Now the interesting thing to note here is that Christ has not promised us the life free of troubles, but rather the foundation and the power to sustain all the troubles. It says that "stream vehemently upon the house". We might go through the fiercest storm but the glorious thing is that we would not shake if oru foundation is Christ.

notes.versetext: And said unto them, Whosoever shall receive this child in my name receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the same shall be great.
notes.versecomment: Message from our God is so clear that only person great in His eyes is the one who is least among all men. God does not look at the credentials of man, He looks the obedience of man. He does not look for the best He makes the best. He does not look for the influential He makes one influential. He does not let His glory flow thru human knowledge and excellence, rather He lets His glory flow thru contrite and humble one.

notes.versetext: But Jesus said unto him, Judas, betrayest thou the Son of man with a kiss?
notes.versecomment: Judas was outwardly trying to show that he loved Jesus while inwardly he was betraying Him. This is exactly possible for anyone and hence we must evaluate ourselves by the help and guidance of the Holy Spirit. Are we look outside as a lover of Christ while inside we have no desire to follow Him or get our personal desires accomplished.

notes.versetext: And ye are witnesses of these things.
notes.versecomment: Jesus Himself has called us the witnesses of all that He has shown us about Himself. He didn't suggest that we are His witnessed but He has affirmed that we are His witnesses and so we should be. We have to live and walk like His witnesses on this earth.

notes.versetext: I am that bread of life.
notes.versecomment: We all eat to survive that our life may continue on this earth but Jesus talking about the bread which is Himself which makes surviving the eternity. He is the bread of life and if we do not nourish ourselves with Him we are starving ourselves and we live with no value only waiting to die.

notes.versetext: If we let him thus alone, all men will believe on him: and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation.
notes.versecomment: The conspiracy against a godly is not a new thing. history has many proofs that wicked always has conspired against the godly. What do we expect our God to do for us? Our God if He wants can remove all wicked in a blink of an eye but He waits for the wicked to turn. God takes the cost of the suffering of His children and faithful ones because of His patience and desire that wicked may turn and live.

notes.versetext: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father's business?
notes.versecomment: The gap between heavenly minded vs earthly minded relationship is visible here. Jesus did not disrespect His parents but He indeed made it very clear that heavenly relationship is a priority for Him. After 12 years of closely watching Jesus why Mary & Joseph was supposed to marvel? Why they would be worried or anxious of His well being?

notes.versetext: But he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth; against which the stream did beat vehemently, and immediately it fell; and the ruin of that house was great.
notes.versecomment:
The difference between these two men Jesus talked about is 1) digging deeper and 2) laying the foundation. Both men indeed heard and till that point, both are the same and looked the same but both had a very different ending. Are we digging deeper in the word? Are we meditating upon it? Are we embracing it as if we have no other mean to live? If we do then we will have a strong and unshakable foundation. But if not then the ruin will be great!

O God set my feet upon the rock in your mercy before its too late. Amen.

notes.versetext: Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.
notes.versecomment:
Jews thought that they were elite people as their forefathers ate the manna in the wilderness but they forget that they hated that manna as well. They did murmur to eat meat in the wilderness. You and I should never boast on the past blessings, God wants us to live in the present and being obedient to Him in the present time. We cannot live or boast on the experiences of our forefathers we surely can learn from it but we cannot please God just chanting how great our forefathers were.

Jesus says they died eating manna in the wilderness, it was not the food which was eternal. Don't rely on the physical things which seemingly may be good and heavenly but we must have our eyes fixed on the invisible and spiritual.

notes.versetext: And Jesus said unto him, Forbid him not: for he that is not against us is for us.
notes.versecomment: This is a very practical issue among brethren. The expectation that for someone to be a real follower of Christ must walk with us is wrong. We must respect others who are the co-workers of Christ whom He has appointed. Obviously, someone can misuse this verse and let anything and anyone passing as a follower of Christ. But that is not what Jesus meant here. A true follower of Christ is appointed by God and bears the fruit worthy of it. Jesus did warn against Pharisees who had the show of all righteousness but would never make to the kingdom of Heaven. We are not supposed to align ourselves with anyone who comes in His name but only those who bears the fruits worthy of it.

notes.versetext: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
notes.versecomment: Mary kept the things in her heart and pondered on it. And this is the 2nd time it is recorded by Luke. In V19 of this chapter is the first record.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, when the time was come that he should be received up, he stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem,
notes.versecomment: Jesus set His face to go to Jerusalem. He knew what kind of sufferings He will go thru in Jerusalem but He was more keen to fulfill God's purpose instead of being laden with self-pity or sorrow. We must be so determined to do God's will even it means facing death and persecution. Death and persecution are not at all an end for us. But once we go thru it the living God Himself will receive us in His eternal glory. O Death where is thy sting! We should be joyful to follow our savior's steps.

notes.versetext: And he saith unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.
notes.versecomment:
when Phillip told Nathanael about Jesus he just brushed it off casually but then he had an encounter with Jesus Himself which brought Him to the point where he could not but say "thou are the Son of God", "thou art the king of Israel". We must know that we may fail to convince someone about Christ and we must not presume either. Our job is to introduce Christ to the lost world. God, Himself is powerful enough to convince any stubborn heart.

Probably Nathanael did not know that Jesus knew him even when he was not in the physical sigh of Him. It didn't take Nathanael to figure out that Jesus was the Son of God. How much we want Jesus to do for us so that we fall at His feet and make Him our God and King?

notes.versetext: And they did not receive him, because his face was as though he would go to Jerusalem.
notes.versecomment: Jesus did not satisfy many religious traditions and leaders. For Samaritans, Jerusalem was never a place of worship. For them, it was Mount Gerizim and hence when they perceived that Jesus is set to go to Jerusalem, they were offended and did not receive him to spend his last day(s) with Him. They already knew who He was and how kind He was to the Samaritan woman and also how he valued a simple good Samaritan over all the Pharisees, Sadducees, Scribes and priests in the temple of Jerusalem. But their religious pride and tradition kept Jesus away!

notes.versetext: When I was daily with you in the temple, ye stretched forth no hands against me: but this is your hour, and the power of darkness.
notes.versecomment: When we see evil triumph we need to understand that that is their hour and of power of darkness. We must not be too anxious and startled about it. God in His eternal wisdom lets the power of darkness have their hour and time. As Jesus let it happened we must let it happen and put ourselves in the hands of God instead of trying to fight.

notes.versetext: And when his disciples James and John saw this, they said, Lord, wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume them, even as Elias did?
notes.versecomment: This shows the utter deprivation of the human heart. Disciples after spending so much time with Jesus it seems were filled with so many follies and natural instincts. Although they really loved the Lord, left all their worldly things aside but they were still in the grip of their fallen nature. They were vengeful and probably ignorant of what God expects from them.

notes.versetext: Then took they him, and led him, and brought him into the high priest's house. And Peter followed afar off.
notes.versecomment: And Peter followed Him afar off. A few hours ago he was boasting to lay his life with Jesus but the moment of fear has taken him over. He is following him afar off. Not sure any of His other disciples were doing the same but it seems they weren't. Peter had a genuine desire to stay with Jesus but he couldn't in his own strength and pride. He ended up following Him afar off. So are we at times we end up following Him afar off. We lose the fervency of following Him due to fear of men or circumstances or whatever other reasons. And its not too long before we also would end up denying Him.

notes.versetext: And when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the hall, and were set down together, Peter sat down among them.
notes.versecomment: Peter sat down with the wrong crowd, the crowd which was after Jesus. Peter was running in his own wisdom, he may have thought that this is the way he can stay with Jesus. But ultimately he ended up denying Jesus three times.

notes.versetext: For the Son of man is not come to destroy men's lives, but to save them. And they went to another village.
notes.versecomment: While Samaritans refused to receive Him, it angered disciples and they wanted to burn them down with the fire from heaven! And Jesus had to rebuke them. Such a vengeful heart is never approved of God. Jesus in His human form set such a great example for us humans to follow. We cannot be vengeful. Vengence belongs to the Lord and not to us. Jesus just turned to another village when not received by Samaritans. We must stay away from the vengeful heart as it will never be approved of God. rather we must pray for the salvation of those who persecute us and harras us.

notes.versetext: And it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certain man said unto him, Lord, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.
notes.versecomment: This man surely had commitment but seems that Jesus did not agree with his desire. It is possible that God may not agree with our plans even though those plans may be godly.

notes.versetext: And Jesus said unto him, Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head.
notes.versecomment: Jesus in His own words described His state on this earth. And it's not that He was helpless and living in a pitiful situation but because of His message and His pure life which was so much at odds with the world that HE hardly can find the place to rest. Godly men walk alone, they do not have much in common with a medicore follower of Christ. It is so difficult to find a kindred soul with whom a serious child of God can get along with. It's not that such man hates others but it is the question of companionship and he does not find rest with the compromising and half-hearted Christians.

notes.versetext: And after a little while another saw him, and said, Thou art also of them. And Peter said, Man, I am not.
notes.versecomment: First Peter denied having known Jesus. Now he denied even being one of them, meaning follower of Christ, or one of His disciples. When we try to keep up with God in our pride, strength or wisdom it does not go too far. This divine principle is so deep and beyond our comprehension but it is so proven times and again that we cannot follow God in our own strength, even to follow Him we need strength and guidance from Him.

notes.versetext: And about the space of one hour after another confidently affirmed, saying, Of a truth this fellow also was with him: for he is a Galilaean.
notes.versecomment: The third time Peter denied even of being from His vicinity. He even acted as if he doesn't know what Galilee is where Jesus also was from. This is such a clear picture of what happens to one who has a genuine desire to follow Christ and even till the death but the grips of fear and safety have overpowered him. Peter boasted that he would follow Jesus unto death but such a determination in his own strength didn't last for long.

notes.versetext: And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.
notes.versecomment: Our God is merciful even in our dire weakness. Jesus turned and looked upon Peter. It was a look of mercy and not condemnation. Jesus just wanted to remind Peter about what He had already said that he would deny Him thrice before the cock crow. Our God knows our follies even beforehand and it's not that He is happy to see us fall but when our pride and self-reliance take us over, He lets us learn the lesson and it is often very painful.

notes.versetext: And Peter went out, and wept bitterly.
notes.versecomment: This is the child of God would do. when he realizes of his sin he is filled with godly sorrow and repentance. This is not just superficial, outward sorrow but it is utter brokenness. This weeping was unusual, it was not emotional but it was heart-piercing. Such repentance bring a great reconciliation with God and it God glorifies Himself in a person who is filled with utter remorse for his sin.
